Reviews.Title: “Great location not family friendly”
Reviews.Author: TR845
Reviews.Content: PROS: Great location, close to many shops and restaurants. Very friendly staff. CONS: okay room, refrigerator not working very well, was dirty and had items from a previous guest. Our room had two double beds, the sheets on one of beds had holes. The maid SERVICE did not into clean entirely. We left trash neatly tied in a bag next to the trash can and it was left there after maid service. Our bathroom sink area was not wiped down, no fresh towels left. Ice machine on our floor did not work, had to go to another floor to get ice. Not the best for families with small children. You have to pay for children's programming. Luckily we have our own DVD player. Overnight parking really expensive plus you have to use valet which requires tipping each time you need your car. I did not bring any of these issue to the attention of the hotel staff as I find most complaints are really addressed with more than lip service. I would stay again, just not with kids. LOTS OF CONSTRUCTION GOING ON.

Reviews.Title: “10 year anniversary”
Reviews.Author: scoobySantaana
Reviews.Content: This was my first time visiting the Westin gaslamp.,im really impressed by the helpfull staff and courteous. we checked in on April 7 2012 at about 3.15 pm the front desk told me that we where upgraded to the Renewal suite . we waited for 2 hours for it to be cleanned eventhough we had to wait to check in the room was huge 2 stories ,Jacuzzi bathtub window seats were really nice good views of the bay and Petco park. i was very impressed , my special thanks go to Andrea and all the staff that made our 10 anniversary stay@ Westin gaslamp very comfortable and also the nice card and Champagne & Strawberries delivered by the staff to our room , i give all the staff and the hotel a perfect 10 this was my most wonderfull experience at a hotel ever wow thanks again i look forward to visiting the Westin gaslamp soon

Reviews.Title: “So many things were wrong it makes for a poor experience”
Reviews.Author: jen916
Reviews.Content: First let me start by saying I have stayed at Westin hotels in the past and had positive experiences. Upon entering the hotel you are greeted with construction which I already knew so that was no surprise. When we entered our hotel room it looked pretty clean until we pulled the blankets back and found blood on the sheets. I brought this to the attention of the front desk and they apologized and said room service would fix it. Room service came in and made the bed and cleaned the room so we didnt even think to check that they changed the sheets since that was our sole complaint. The next morning we threw the covers off the bed and there and behold were the same sheets...now I am completely grossed out. We stayed for 4 days and were never given a new bottom sheet. Upon checkout I again mentioned this and they said I would get POINTS on our rewards card. They didnt even give us half the amount of points for a one night stay. We took a dip in the hottub which had a top layer of foam which was covered in a green slime. We promptly got out and took showers. We were woken up to the loud sounds of union protests Saturday morning. I also felt the thermostat was not cool enough even though we had it on the lowest setting. I thought the conceirge desk was very helpful with several suggestions of great places to eat and how to get around. Overall just too many major things wrong for a 4 night stay to earn a good review.. which had little to nothing to do with construction more a lack of attention to detail and cleanlines. Also in my opinion not enough done on managements side to correct the issues or make it up to us.

Reviews.Title: “Wait until construction is over - at least the end of May 2012!”
Reviews.Author: Rod M
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many Westin hotels in the past and always found them to be a step above the norm. The Westin Gaslamp does not meet this standard. At checkin, we learned it was $10 a day for wireless! Come on, who still charges for wireless? But that was only the first surprise..... I write this on night 5 of a 7 day stay. Days one and two were spent with no hot water. Nothing like not being able to shower in the morning! Day two also saw the elevators out of order. With the service elevators overtaxed, we got a free workout seeing as we are on the 11th floor. On day 4 it was labor unrest. A full volume demonstration with drums, loud speakers and picketing protestors was just ourside the front door of the lobby and lasted for 3 hours. At the start of day 5 we were down to 2 of the 4 elevators working and a very long wait for a ride to or from the lobby. This was because there was fresh tile laid in front of the other two elevators. The rest of the hall is in the process of being renovated now. I wonder if any of the elevators will be running tomorrow morning? On the positive side, the room was very nice - except the pocket door in the bathroon doesn't close all the way so privacy is limited. The staff is very helpful and cooperative, but if I was looking to stay in the Gaslamp area of San Diego, I would wait until May at least for the renovations to be finished or you will be in for some surprises like we have experienced. For the price we are paying for the room we expect more, and with all the inconveniences, we have received apologies, but no offers of compensation. I wonder what days 6 and 7 in room will hold for us!

Reviews.Title: “Green & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lws07
Reviews.Content: My decision to stay here was because a couple I was traveling with wanted to use Starwood points and we all wanted to be in the Gaslamp area. I was a little worried based on the reviews mentioning construction, but in my room request (Deluxe City View w/King room at $153 a night) I asked to be away from the construction and not have a room with an adjoining door. That worked like a charm because I got a room 1639 on the top floor! It had great views and I didn't hear any construction noise at all. There was some street noise still, especially echoing of sirens at night, but I got used that that quickly. One bummer was that even though my computer picked up the signal of free wireless spots, none of them actually worked. I had my own hotspot, but beware that the Westin's wifi does cost money. There was also limited dresser drawers if you're staying multiple nights with someone else. There were 3 smaller sized drawers in the closet, but that was all. At least there were a good # of hangers. One thing the hotel had that I had never seen before was the option to be green and skip housekeeping FOR MONEY. I've been to hotels before where they ask you to be green by opting out of new towels, etc, but this time they offered you a $5 credit to their facilities (pseudo-Starbucks, bar, etc.). I don't mind passing on housekeeping so I did this every day I was there, except for the night before check out which they don't offer the deal for. Each day I got to treat myself to a Starbucks drink as a result! The hotel was green in other ways, too. They had a recycling bin in the room (1st I've seen) and used toilet paper that contained at least 20% post consumer product. In their gym, which is open 24 hours, the elliptical machines save the energy from/get powered by your workout. Speaking of their fitness center, I have to give it props. It has a more than a full set of dumb bells, has a full body workout machine, several ellipticals and treadmills, and a recumbent and upright bike. They have a water fountain with cups, but I used the bottled water that they give you for free in the room. Towels are also available, even moist, cooled ones kept in a mini fridge. The location of the hotel was probably the best part. It's 2 blocks away from the light rail/trolley transit, right next to the Horton Plaza mall (has a CVS very close by if you want to stock your mini fridge) if you want to do some shopping, and in the gas lamp quarter which gives you a ton of restaurant options! A cab from the airport to the hotel, and back, average $15 without tip. We had a car for a few nights, and the parking at the hotel was $32 a day, with unlimited in/out privileges. But you have to leave with the valet, so it's more when you factor in tipping. Even though $32 seems pricey, I checked around the immediate area and nowhere else had a lower rate. I requested a later check out time, and was able to get 1pm, although I didn't end up needing it. When I checked out, the hotel employee asked how everything was. I told her there were a few hiccups (hot water didn't work one morning) and another morning there was a random, but loud, protest next door to the hotel at 7 am. She felt my pain and gave me a $20 credit, which was good at the same places as the $5 green credit. Before I left, I was able to stock up on Starbucks drinks for me and my friends. Overall, this was good choice for a place to stay. They seem to be aware of the problems they're having due to their construction and priced the room accordingly. Once the construction is done, I'm sure this place with be even better (and more expensive)!

Reviews.Title: “recent visit”
Reviews.Author: rudel7249
Reviews.Content: We found the staff most courteous and accommodating. Hotel is under some construction which threw us off somewhat but we still had a good time. We would like to recognize Ms Reyna Cruz, HouseKeeping, for tending to some special needs and doing so in a most friendly, helpful manner. What a difference it makes.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay at best...”
Reviews.Author: preciouzlily
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days on the weekend on 3/23/12. This is actually the first time I am writing a somewhat negative review about a hotel. Now don't get me wrong, I knew there were going to be renovations. That itself was not the issue. For Westin's reputation, I expected better. There were problems with the hot water. Basically we got frozen than burned in the showers. Other occupants complained of the same thing that weekend. The only good night was Thursday night before they decided to fix the boiler!!! There were problems with the heater, they sent someone up to fix it, it never really worked. We didn't bother calling them again because it wasn't like we were freezing at night. The WORST was the lack of housekeeping services for us. We made the mistake of deciding to go "green" during check in. When we changed our minds the next morning, we were told that housekeeping service would be provided for sure. We get back to the hotel at night, no housekeeping. Next morning, early morning, we go down to front desk and ask for housekeeping service again and informed them that they never came the day earlier. Once again, we were told that for sure housekeeping would stop by. In the end, we complained again that third night with zero housekeeping services and they kindly gave me thousands of SPG reward points. But I highly doubt I would stay at another Westin in the future. I've stayed at hotels with less stars and they have been better!!! I was just kind of shocked by how disappointed I was...

Reviews.Title: “Good service, excellent location, some flaws”
Reviews.Author: REEMaryland
Reviews.Content: Despite what the Director of Operations says, the only place I saw that renovations were going on is here on TripAdvisor. That being said, the renovations were for the most part not an issue. There are two points that you should be aware of: there is a lobby bar/deli counter instead of an actual bar or restaurant. This isn't a big deal because there are dozens of great bars and restaurants very close to the hotel. The other problem I faced is with the hot water. They had just replaced the hot water boiler/heater and air bubbles in the hot water lines would disrupt the flow of hot water to my shower. The problem seemed to be transient and there wasn't really anything the engineers could do to fix it, but a couple of showers where you lose hot water mid-shower is quite annoying. Others have posted complaints about the noise of renovation. It did not bother me, but I was out of the room most of the day. Other than that, the hotel was decent. I requested a room that would be quiet at night and was given a room at the end of the hall (thank you!). I could hear people in the stairwell, but that was very unusual. The room was comfortable, clean, and fairly large. Noise isolation was mixed. I could hear toilets flushing and some street noise (on the 9th floor), but I didn't hear conversations or TV from neighboring rooms. I didn't hear the trains, trolley, and only heard one plane (the airport is not very far). Location is excellent, it's adjacent to Horton Plaza, the large downtown mall and the Gaslamp Quater. It's a 10 minute walk to the convention center and also has easy access to the trolley and train station. I didn't have a car, but I understand that parking is quite expensive. I really like the "green choice" option. $5 or 500 points for each day I don't use housekeeping. Considering I rarely need housekeeping when I'm traveling alone, this is a nice benefit for me and the hotel. I didn't use the pool or gym, so I cannot comment on either. Nice touches: available outlets on the desk and at the bedside. Little things done wrong: 1) ethernet cable was woefully short; I had to move the computer to the back of the desk to connect it. Yes, there is WiFi, but when wired is available, I prefer it because it is faster and more secure. 2) The alarm clock does not support mp3/ipods. This is the first post-renovation hotel I've stayed in that didn't have an alarm clock with this connectivity.

Reviews.Title: “Really 3.5 stars...”
Reviews.Author: CDP5
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the eighth floor for one night while in San Diego for business. The room was modern and mostly clean, but had a few issues: (1) the television remote control was old and dirty, and the tv did not work, (2) the faucet on the sink leaked water which led to a puddle on the floor every time I used the sink, (3) the bathroom had a very odd skunk like odor when I first arrived in the room, (4) the walls in the room are extremely thin and I could hear everything clearly in other rooms. The hotel restaurant and lobby areas were under construction while I was there, but still appeared orderly. The staff was friendly and professional. I hope that I had a room that was an anomaly, as I have generally had good experiences with Westin properties elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: epaula
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend getaway. It was my first time in San Diego. the staff was very helpful. the bed was so comfortable. i usually have trouble sleeping, but not at this hotel. On top of that, the room was spotless. This was also the perfect location. At night, we could walk to loads of restaurants. During the day we could walk along the waterfront. There is also a shopping mall nest to the hotel. All in all this was a great experience. We would definitely stay there again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly bar staff”
Reviews.Author: T S
Reviews.Content: Although there were some renovations going on, the Tina (Bartender) and Bryan (Manager) were extremely accommodating and very friendly. I can honestly say talking with them was the highlight of my trip. The Hotel was beautiful and enjoyed everything about it, but those two made the best of a situation that is beyond their control.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best place for a family visit”
Reviews.Author: tuscany1943
Reviews.Content: having stayed at many Westin properties, this one was a disappointment. The area it is in,although convenient, is also a little scary at night. The mall (right next door) attracts a crowd that I did not expect, including many panhandlers. The Westin staff, is friendly enough, but the construction in the lobby feels like I am entering a motel 6 not a Westin property. They should offer discounts when construction of this type takes place. The room was typically Westin, comfortable bed,nice TV. If you want to party with a bunch of Mardi Gras types, go to the Gas lamp area after 12, if not head elsewhere. if you need a snack, stay away from room service or the lobby cafe,overpriced and not the best, also avoid the mall next door ,unless fast fried food is on your list of favorites. One more negative, the Westin down the street will pick you up from the airport, this one, only blocks away will not They will however get you a taxi, then all you will need to do is figure out how to communicate with the driver, and beware of overcharging,watch the meter!

Reviews.Title: “Some Good, Some Bad”
Reviews.Author: 60922Evc
Reviews.Content: Our stay from 3/7 thru 3/14 was not exactly the most enjoyable. When making reservations, customers should be told that construction is going on. I know that deters reservations but I also think its better for the customer to be in accomodations that are not being disturbed, noisy and dusty. Room service was excellent! However, gratuity on top of gratuity is absurb and absolutly uncalled for. Again this should be made very clear by the room service person when they bring your food to your room. Most people do not check this and I'm sure the staff makes a ton of extra money that is covertly achieved. A doorman at the hotel on March 13, his name is Ryan, was very observant with a personal crisis I was going through and went over and above comforting me and making sure that I was taken care of. Kudos to him and I hope that he is told about this as I am so grateful that he was in the right place at the right time to help me with my personal crisis.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Room + Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: rvvargas
Reviews.Content: My company always sends employees to Starwood hotels and mostly the Westin Gaslamp when business needs to get done in San Diego. This was my second time here, and I must say, each time has been impressive. The last I was there, I was given the same genuine service as my first visit. I came in with my hands occupied with luggage and right when the bellman saw me he instantly grabbed them as if I wasn't allowed to do any heavy lifting. Victor was very very courteous. He reminded me of my father, which is why we were able to strike up a small conversation. I just wish I had more change so that I could have tipped more. When I went to check in for my room, Maria (I think that's what her name is) greeted me promptly. Her sweet and angelic voice made up for the noisy construction going on in the background. Other than the hospitable service I received from everyone, I didn't have any problems with the room. However, the design of my room seemed a little dull. If I were picking a room for my girlfriends and I to stay in for a night in San Diego, I'm not sure I'd pick this place. Anyway, it was still cozy nevertheless. All in all, with the great service I constantly receive and cozy (!) beds they have, I'd definitely recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Ehh, ok”
Reviews.Author: shalbleib
Reviews.Content: Nice lobby and a fairly nice room. Location was ok, pool was in the shade, and no mention during the reservation process of any construction going on! Pretty pathetic customer regard at $200+ a night. I'll probably shy away from Westin's from now on just for their lack of consideration and mediocre accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Three stars at best”
Reviews.Author: Jenna M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very disappointing for a Westin. No mini bar, no real room service. Rooms are outdated and the whole hotel is under construction, which means a lot of noise starting at 7:30.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BruceCaplan
Reviews.Content: I was doing a book signing for the Titanic Exhibit in San Diego. My wife and I were looking for a central location that was close to everything. The Westin Hotel in the Gaslamp Quarter fit our every need! There are scores of restaurants and shops nearby. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable. The staff is outstanding and did all they could to make our stay pleasant and wonderful! We stay in hotels all over our great Nation, and this by far was one of our most enjoyable experiences! Bruce Caplan Author of --"The Sinking of the Titanic".

Reviews.Title: “Worst Ever. So Glad I Wasn't Picking Up the Tab”
Reviews.Author: Brad1970
Reviews.Content: Okay if you look at my review history, you'll see I trend towards very positive reviews. The one stars from me are extremely rare and only when I note egregious problems. I certainly found those right here at the Westin. I stayed here for five nights and had the absolute worst experience ever in a hotel. Let me preface this by saying my review is NOT about the issues surrounding construction. I'll hit on those, but the problems went far deeper than that. For starters, due to the heavy construction, you can't even enter the hotel from the main street. They could keep the main entrance open but decided to put a sign in front blocking guests from entering the easy way. After driving around for an extra 15 minutes, I finally found the secret entrance and could squeeze into the very narrow way. Upon checking into my room, I noticed a nice white robe hanging up in my bathroom. Upon closer inspection I saw a blood stain on it! I've included a photo here in my review. I don't use hotel robes anyway but it was unnerving seeing it there. I decided to leave it up for the entire week to see if the cleaning staff would notice and remove it. They didn't. It gets worse. The climate control in room was well, out of control. It was so hot I literally had to flip my pillow over in the night so I wouldn't be laying on a wet pillow. Gross but true. The front desk blamed it on construction but the thermostat wouldn't let me turn the setting below 65 degrees. I think that was the problem, not the construction. But okay, while we're on construction, the worst part of that involved the elevators. First, you had to walk a long, loud maze of dusty construction just to get to them. And two out of four were completely down and you had to wait in long lines just to jam into one like a sardine. In the mornings, when I wanted to go downstairs, I had to take the elevator up to the top floor to get into a short line and ride it down. Otherwise, the elevator would be too full by the time it got to me and have to pass me by. It gets worse. One day, for no apparent reason, the cleaning staff completely missed my room. I did not have the Do Not Disturb sign up or anything, they just missed me. I went down personally to let the front desk know. They apologized and said they'd make sure it got clean tomorrow. Well thanks a lot. That doesn't do me much good now. Did I mention they charge for WiFi? Something else I found odd was that the remote control to my TV had apparently been used so much that all of the numbers except the 5 were completely worn off (see photo). Now my TV at home gets used a lot more every day than a hotel remote possibly could and my numbers are not worn off. This is just another indication of the lack of attention to detail I consistently saw here. Upon check out, the lady asked how my visit went. I told her it was rough. She blamed it on the construction. Nothing more. No apology. Nothing. I was extremely disappointed in the multiple problems I encountered. Most concerning to me was the hotel staff's reluctance to try to do anything at all about it. An offer, some points, a free future stay once construction is complete, a bottle of champagne, a plate of cookies - anything would have been a nice gesture. But nothing at all was offered at any time despite these issues. What's funny is I'm usually a Marriott point person and try to stay in Marriotts whenever I travel (as you'll see in my reviews). This time I decided to change things up a bit and give a Westin a try. I'm very sorry that I did. Marriott? Will you take me back?

Reviews.Title: “a pleasant stay-handicapped room”
Reviews.Author: gloria p
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night last Jan. and were assigned a handicapped room although not requested. The room was bright and spacious with a very comfortable king bed. The hallway to the bathroom easily accommodated a wheel chair.The light switch in the hall and bathroom could be set as a sensor.The bathroom had a pocket door, ample hand bars and the vanity was high enough for a wheel chair to use comfortably. The hotel is old but renovated. No dining room but Panera Bakery is across the road and the mall with all name stores and shoppes is very close by. .Valet parking with in and out privileges for guests is available.

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: angelinapink
Reviews.Content: Yes, they were doing some building renovation work to the lobby, but it didnt really affect our stay here. The rooms were large, and very comfortable. The staff were very friendly and vey helpful. Good coffee machine in the room, but would have preferred some proper cups rather than the paper ones.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ok value, lots of renos going on”
Reviews.Author: John660
Reviews.Content: Loved the location of this hotel, but wasn't thrilled with all the little extra charges ($14 per night for internet, $32 per night for valet, etc). Room was very nice and spacious, but lack of a bathroom fan is a huge oversight. Lots of renos going on in the hotel, so would have liked to have seen some concessions coming our way for this.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: hanibatutu
Reviews.Content: Having spent 4 years walking by this hotel almost every day when I worked close bye, I finally stayed here for one night on business after I moved out of San Diego. The hotel is clean and the room is spacious and updated. The location is great as its just a few blocks from all the restaurants and bars of the gaslamp. But because its not right in the middle of it, the hotel is a little quieter (and cheaper). Would definitely stay again (and make sure you check out the bar across the street, Dobsons!).

Reviews.Title: “Lot of work needed”
Reviews.Author: thedjlee
Reviews.Content: The hotel is undergoing a major refurbishment, making it a difficult time for the guests and the staff. The foyer is brand new - only finished the weekend prior to my stay. There is still so much building dust - not good for allergy sufferers. The elevators are terrible! Two operating lifts for all the guests? Give me a break! Peak times have you waiting in a queue to get a lift to your room. WiFi in the rooms is patchy, at best. Use a cable for your laptop, and the Internet is better; iPad users will struggle with poor signal strength. Even though I paid for Internet - about $10 a night - I found myself sitting in the hotel foyer using the free WiFi, because the signal was better. To cap off my experience, the hotel advised of power being switched off during my check-out time. Had to walk up to the 6th floor, pack in half-darkness, then struggle with my suitcase back down the fire escape, and hand my keys in. I cannot fault the staff. They are working under difficult circumstances and doing their best. The makeshift restaurant was in a dimly lit function room with a sparse a-la-carte menu. I felt bad for the servers. I do however, find fault with Starwood. There was absolutely no price reduction for the clear reduction in facility and service levels. According to the card I carry, I am a "Preferred Guest". After this recent experience, I think not.

Reviews.Title: “A week at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: Bob W
Reviews.Content: I spent the week of January 29th, 2012 at the Westin Gaslamp Quarter hotel. I was attending a business meeting scheduled to be held at the hotel. Prior to making my reservations I checked reviews on the web and was somewhat concerned since a number of them were very negative. However, based on the convenience of staying where the meetings were being held I booked a room. From the moment I pulled up in a cab to my early departure at the end of the week I was overwhelmed by the attention and friendliness of the staff. They all went out of there way to insure my needs were met . The hotel was undergoing some construction , but it had no impact on my stay. The meals served during the meetings were very good. The room was spacious and clean. All told a 5 star stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beware non-disclosure of construction, noise and disruption, and they blamed it on Expedia.”
Reviews.Author: Nelsonville
Reviews.Content: Booked thru Expedia, no disclosure of major construction noise and disruptions. Jackhammer noise travelled up elevator shaft all day. Speaking of elevators, all shut down but one, presumably due to construction, resulting in long waits and people jamming in because they waited so long. Rode in one elevator where a mom with young kids became the "guard" as it stopped on every floor and she kept people from crushing in. When I called guest services they blamed Expedia for lack of disclosure. Told me they were getting a lot of complaints from people who booked through Expedia.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: geordiegirl19
Reviews.Content: booked this hotel after reading the reviews on tripadvisor, the hotel is right in the hub of things and a car is not needed, the room was spotless and cleaned everyday we were there, they are busy with building work of the new reception but this did not impede on our holiday and we did not hear any building noise, the thing that i would agree with some of the reviews was the flushing of the toilet, this is soo loud and its like the ones on a aircraft!! we didnt flush it through the night after a pee but other people did and this woke us up as so loud, the beds were really comfortable and even though the toilet flush was loud i would stay here again as it was a really friendly hotel and the staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice , but not WOW nice”
Reviews.Author: Droppinloads
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Feb 2012. Lobby and driveway was under construction. Fortunately I heard no noise at all on the 8th floor. Rooms are good size. Tv is a nice big flat screen , but tv reception is horrid. Bathroom is modern but shower is a tub white plastic thing. Usually the higher end hotels I stay at have a glass shower. All in all, it's a nice location and the staff is super nice. David, the bartender in the restaurant bar, was super cool and nice when I was there having some drinks. I would stay here again, but hopefully at a lower price than what I paid for this visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service & food - Business Mtg”
Reviews.Author: cindyloum
Reviews.Content: I just completed a meeting here for a client. The hotel was under construction but the hotel staff worked very hard to mitigate any issues. They bent over backwards to accommodate us in every way. The meeting space is beautiful and recently redone. The food was EXCELLENT! We had an event that required us to walk outside, from the main building to the ballroom - it started pouring rain, but the staff scrambled to set up umbrellas to keep our attendees out of the rain. The service level here was exceptional - first class all the way. Overall an amazing property - a special thanks to Susan Conway, Danielle, Kristin and Arno who worked so hard to make our meeting a huge success.

Reviews.Title: “Too many things went wrong”
Reviews.Author: PacoCA
Reviews.Content: First I get there for a 2 night stay and the main entrance is under construction. You have to enter through a side door. I get in and there is one person running the desk with two customers in front of me. It took 20 minutes before I made it to the desk. The poor girl is ringing the little white buzzer behind her to get another person to help out, which happens right when I make it to the counter. The girl finds my reservation, and tries to run my card, but it wont read. Nothing wrong with the card, but it just says her computer cant read the card. She calls some number to find out what is wrong and after 20 minutes, she comes back and says, she's still on hold, and asked if I had another card. I told her I need to put it on my company card, and that I just used the card so i know it's not the card, so she goes back and tries the phone again....still nothing. In the mean time, the guy next to me checks in 5 people!! Finally I told her to just run my personal card. I don't blame her, I actually felt bad for her, I blame the computer system that would not read the card. I thought that after all the trouble they would give me a room with an ocean view, but no, they gave me a view of the ongoing construction. I get to the room (829), and it was pretty beat up. The pocket door to the bathroom was almost impossible to close (I have arthritis) because it was scraping against some internal mechanism. The wood at the bottom of the sink assembly was all banged up. The klinex box had one tissue in it, the TV remote barely worked, and the area around the lamp was not vacuumed. I head to my meeting and get back around 4:30 PM. I try to take a quick nap, and a few minutes later, I wake up to a bunch of loud noise coming from outside my window. I look down and see a bunch of union construction people yelling to loud banging music, for TWO HOURS. I go back to my meeting and out to dinner. I get back and try to go to sleep. Somewhere on my floor, there is a door that is closing and every time it does, it shakes my bed. It wakes me several times. The lights are on a motion sensor, and they continually pick up my feet moving in the bed, and they go on, keeping me up. I slept very little. The morning greets me at 7:00 AM with more union people yelling SCABS go home. I look out the window and they are already starting construction. They say that construction does not start until 8:00 AM, but it started, right below my window at 7. They have a program where you get $5 credit if you ask them not to change the sheets. I put out the card, but they never gave me anything. The elevators were slow and always full. There are 4 of them but I don't think 2 were running. The lay out of the floors to the rooms is very confusing. The convention rate for the rooms was $50 more than the going rate online. The only reason it got 2 stars was the comfortable beds. San Diego certainly is America's finest city, but this hotel is not the reason why!

Reviews.Title: “very good experience”
Reviews.Author: gsweston
Reviews.Content: great location, great staff, only a few things that distract from excellence: lobby under construction, some protests or demonstrations just outside the hotel entrance, long waits for elevators (they could easily double the number for the size of the hotel), large screen televisions in rooms but no HD channels; overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to downtown San Diego with no hesitation

Reviews.Title: “Attn: Brian Baucum F& B Supervisor”
Reviews.Author: Joe W
Reviews.Content: Our experience last Saturday night at your hotel was made extremely nice due to the efforts of Brian Baucum. We had attempted to make reservations several days in advance and were told there was no rooms available at your facilities as well as other Westin properties in the area. Brian had conversation with my sister-in-law and brother-in-law on Friday as they had been staying in the hotel since Thursday and he was kind enough of looking into the possibilities of a room available for Saturday night. His extra effort in finding a room for us at your hotel so that we were able to spend time with our family and enjoy the many other employees that your hotel has working there. Looking forward to returning to your location in the near future and look forward to experiencing the same fine accommodations that we had on this trip. Joe Wilson- Owner jwilson@imageconcepts.net | P. 800.690.3456 | F. 714.966.2143 www.imageconcepts.net | Branded | Premiums | Logo Products | Custom Printing

Reviews.Title: “I hate to give this nice hotel only 3 stars”
Reviews.Author: dessny
Reviews.Content: My husband and I both couldn't decide 3 or 4 stars. It was a nice place. Pleasantly decorated. Nice staff. (except the house keeper would just open the door after 9 a.m. like a big "get the heck out of your room.") But it was the small things to cause the 3 stars. The elevators took FOREVER. My husband claims "hours of lost time waiting on the elevator." The water was nearly impossible to find a nice temp to wash my face, or usually to shower with. My husband, myself, and someone else traveling with us in another room all couldn't sleep and had sore backs because the beds were so hard! Here was our biggest issue... THE AUTOMATIC LIGHTS. OMG this killed sleep. I've stayed plenty of places with auto light switches and never had a problem. This one, we would turn it off with the button, you could walk around in front of it for a while and it would stay off. Some how in the middle of the night, when I would push the covers off, it would detect the motion and turn the lights on! And try getting up in the middle of the night to use the bathroom and getting bombarded with lights the whole way..... :( 4 nights at this hotel and did not get a good nights sleep. I usually look forward to hotels to get away from my old saggy mattress at home. We slept like babies once we got home! But on the up side, it was in a good location, had a quiet refrigerator in the room and was reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “If you can get a deal, go here !”
Reviews.Author: stmalcolm
Reviews.Content: We stayed this week and the hotel is in a great location for the conference center with just a nice walk, 0.5 mile each way. No airport transfer, $15 by taxi at night, $12 during the day (I am a bad tipper !). The hotel is being remodelled, the good point is it won't impact on your stay, the bad news is there is only one bar. Staff were friendly. I got a deal on hotels.com which made it a very cost effective stay. WiFi is expensive (i.e. it isn't free !), however you can connect a number of devices for one connection fee (we used iPhone and PC).

Reviews.Title: “Well rounded”
Reviews.Author: MisterNathan
Reviews.Content: I just spend 4 days, 3 nights. The property was nice. Rooms, conference center, gym, lobby, and pool were all clean and tidy. I found no issues to mention whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, large room, great location.”
Reviews.Author: David0077
Reviews.Content: I was at the hotel for a conference and had a good time. Staff are very friendly and helpful. I was upgraded to a large room with an ocean view. The work area in the room is well-designed. Negatives: the carpet and drapes look drab and old, valet parking and WiFi charges are high. To attract business travellers, it would seem to me that free WiFi would pay off.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but....”
Reviews.Author: MTRoamer
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel before, many years ago and really enjoyed my time there. I was excited to see it listed as the venue to our industry conference in Jan. 2012. When I arrived the entire hotel is under construction. There was dust everywhere and noise, and general confusion due to the temporary desks, walls and lobby layout. The motion sensor lights in the room sound like a good idea, but when your foot is in the line of sight of the sensor and you roll over while sleeping, it is hard to get much sleep when the lights keep turning on. I hope they finish construction soon and find a better solution to the energy saving efforts.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kellyLynn_8
Reviews.Content: Hotel was recently renovated and very clean. Easy access to restaurants, shopping, and a short walk to the convention center. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. Parking was a bit of an issue as they only offer valet and the price is high. Overall a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: bob_pate
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this facility in January 2012 for four nights. The primary purpose was to attend a meeting (which was taking place in this hotel) so I had booked the hotel on that basis. I had not reviewed the tripadvisor review prior to the booking. Here are findings: a. The hotel is going through some renovation on ground facility so it is difficult to go through in and out. Not sure how long this construction will last. b. After check-in I saw a cockroach (literally 1 1/2" long) -- near elevator (close to their check-in desk). I pulled their staff and showed. Instead of taking care of this pest, the reaction from their employee is that this is to be expected as the hotel is in downtown. (From my standpoint, this is sorry excuse and from that point on, I was concerned of what to expect at this facility.) c. The hotel is wired for wi-fi; however, the reception is not always good -- depending upon the location. d. The fees for Wi-Fi is expensive (almost $60 for one week). Also you can't use wi-fi on your mobile device (such as iPhone or iPad) along with your personal computer. It allows you to access Internet on one or the other but no both. e. The room was OK; however, the ironing board in the room is very small and when expanded, it only reaches 3" ft height so you better bend in order to use it. f. The TV and supported channels -- basic cable. For class of this hotel, I would have expected more. Certainly they were pushing for on-demand movies and adult entertainment programs. g. Housekeeping stuff -- ought to be reminded -- as they kept forgetting soap for shower or facial washing I used their gym and the facility was OK. You can watch TV while excercising on many equipments. However, you can't change the channel so unless you content to watch CNN all times, you will be disappointed. Had attended meetings in the hotel and the meeting rooms were OK. We had breakfast served in the meeting rooms and I am not sure how it may compare with standard breakfast served in their restaurent. The best part of the hotel was that it was close to other dining places within walking distance and you have lot of choices for dinner. Lastly the hotel charges $35 per night for valet parking so I strongly advice to take taxi from the airport. It will cost about $15 (incl tip).

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, but windows are paper thin”
Reviews.Author: SoCalBeachGirl
Reviews.Content: I can give some leeway for properties that are under construction, but I really hope the windows in the room are part of the planned renovation as the current ones are paper-thin and may as well been wide open. The room decor has been renovated so it was modern and sleek. The ice skating rink across the street was playing music and it sounded like a speaker was set up in our room. The whole reason we booked a room was for a conference that started at 6:30am, having to wait until 10pm for the music to stop didn't help. It's a convenient downtown location, but it sounded like we were on the streets of New York. Every siren could be heard from blocks away, and we could audibly hear voices from people walking on the street below. Don't stay here if you're looking for a good night's sleep, but if you want to party all night, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Good but the renovations were a bit of a problem”
Reviews.Author: TerpyTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and loved the service and amenities. Our biggest problem was with the renovations they were actively making to the building. During the day we could hear construction noises from our room though it wasn't enough to keep us from taking a nap. Otherwise, the service, food, and room were great. Also of note, they only offer valet parking, if you want to park on your own, you have to use the garage next to the building.

Reviews.Title: “A great weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: Claudia S
Reviews.Content: Although there was construction taking place it did not affect our stay at all. This was our first time in SD and our first time at the Westin and it was well spent. We were treated very well by all staff members from the very beginning. Check-in was fast and easy, our room was clean and our expectations of the room were definitely met. We had questions of dining and where we should go for great nightlife and Martin at the front desk was very helpful in recommending a few places that met our needs. He had also recommended the hotels bar & grill...the chocolate lava cake is A MUST and in all honesty I can not wait for the next time my friends and I come down.

Reviews.Title: “Good but Under Construction til ?Mar2012”
Reviews.Author: J S
Reviews.Content: Comfortable and clean room but small - a little disappointed by the construction. Only the Hotel lobby is under construction, which signified the Hotel price reduction compared to the rest. We did get great service from valet, manager, and check in and helpful hints on where to eat during our stay. Location is great - The Hotel is connected to Horton Plaza by Macy's and a short walk to Gas Lamp District. We ate excellent Breakfast at Richard Walkers (3 blocks away)- and had no problem getting around. You can catch the SD Trolley tour at Horton Plaza which takes you on a 2 hr trip all around San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Poor reviews not warranted.”
Reviews.Author: jkentris
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our 3 nite stay. The staff was professional and attentive, the facility is spotless and in the best location! The fitness center is superb. The one issue I have is the analog tv reception on the beautiful flat screen tv. Get the high def please. We will stay here for future trips to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Love the location!”
Reviews.Author: msginaj
Reviews.Content: The Westin is always nice, but this was my first time at the Westin San Diego Gaslamp Quarter. The location is perfect! We could walk to restaurants, bars and shopping very easily. Also, the Convention center is not far at all. We even had a water view from our room. The room was cozy, not too big but it worked and the bed was "Heavenly" just as they advertised. I would say the only complaint was that they really couldn't tell us much about the Trolly system which runs through the city. We asked at the concierge desk and they had no idea? I thought that was weird since it stopped right down the street at the mall. I guess we could have looked into it ourselves but we did have a car so we just drove to the places we went. The San Diego Zoo is close by, the Balboa Park and of course we visited the Hotel Del Coronado. Oh yeah, another complaint is the $30 per day Parking charge!! If you're staying more than a couple days this REALLY adds up! I think they really need to reduce that fee. Overall we had a great stay and will probably return.

Reviews.Title: “Construction Work Spoiling Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robh9999
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel before & think it is what you would expect to find from a city centre Westin, but in a really great location. It isn't the best Westin I have stayed in & I have had some service niggles, but I would probably use it again. I stayed in November & found major construction going on as the whole of the entrance & lobby is being replaced - this is a big job. The first impact is that you cannot access the hotel from the usual street, which means a convoluted drive around the one way system to find the rear access. It would have been simple to have mentioned this on the hotel website - but there was no mention of this (or the construction) which meant a succession of people turning up at the entrance & not being able to get in. This was really poor customer service. The second impact was the fact that the hotel entrance was now adjacent to the bar & restaurant, which meant that these were really cold because the temporary partition wall between the bar & the entrance passage didn't go up as far as the ceiling. The third impact was noise - the work was incredibly noisy & I'm sure the check in staff must have had a continual headache. Frankly, I think they should have closed the hotel at least whilst they did the demolition.

Reviews.Title: “Just a quick note on the Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Danny M
Reviews.Content: twice a year we have a training conference. people are from all across america. even though the hotel was under renovation the staff was helpful and pretty much eliminated any interferance that the work might have caused. i have been setting up these conferences for many years and this is the first time i got ZERO complaints from the attendees. I want to give a special thanks to the following Laurel Wykes, Susan Conway, Danielle Anderson, Mark Greim, Jose Gomez, and our attendant Edgar. I was again amazed at the amount of energy and coordination that it takes to successfully have a conference and these people made it easy. thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: snp83
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in January. I thought it was a great stay. Clean, good services, very helpful staff. Wish I could have used the gym or pool but didn't have time. It's perfect distance to walk to most the sights(including the USS Midway). Would most definitely stay at this hotel again if I went.

Reviews.Title: “Not good”
Reviews.Author: 1Getupandgo
Reviews.Content: The location was great and that's about it. The entry seems to be under construction so access was extremely confusing. The Valet team is great but the rest of the team seemed to be disinterested in maintaining high standards. The check-in experience was abrupt and incomplete effectively consisting of key handing over. Our room was tight and had a strange aroma. There were clearly continually missed spots from the housekeepers and, oddly, our guestroom with two double beds offered one robe. Not the Starwood/Westin experience anticipated.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Lise C
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at this hotel during the Christmas break. We were travelling with our 3 children and had 2 adjoining rooms. We were somewhat disappointed on arrival as there were major renovations going on in the lobby and entrance area (I should have read the recent trip advisor reviews!!). Our rooms were clean and functional but we had problems with the pluming in both bathrooms (sinks backing up and a dripping shower faucet). We notified maintenance, they promptly 'fixed' the problem...the next morning the pluming issues were back in both bathrooms. Both concierges we spoke to were very helpful in recommending restaurants and activities. The reception and bell staff were also very curtious. The local area was great, lots of restaurants, shopping and easy access to public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: travelfiend_30
Reviews.Content: My 3* review might be a little harsh, but I find myself unable to give this hotel more stars at this point in time. The renovation going on as well as a series of other issues make this a 3 star experience for me, though I will admit that the level of service and the willingness to resolve my issues give me the impression that maybe i was a tad unlucky. What were the issues? Heating didn't work right the first night so my daughter was freezing all night. It takes the (expensive) vallet forever and a day to pull out your car every time you need it. Room service took 45 minutes "because it took a long time to boild the hard-boiled egg" (huh?). I called my own CA phone number to locate my phone and was charged almost $8 for that 1-second (literally) call (even though the charges were reluctantly reversed). They have several Internet access speeds and for whatever reason the person in reception told me I could choose the fast one and get charged for the slow one, but charged me for the fast one anyway. So nothing too awful, but just too many issues for a 2 day stay at a hotel that tries to be high level. Having said that, location is superb, rooms clean and service generally very good.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight at Westin Gaslamp Quarter”
Reviews.Author: mach2point0
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight at the Westin Gaslamp Quarter in San Diego. Was given a room on the 16th floor looking East towards the hills with a view of the ice rink in the Westfield centre - not that I was there for the view!! Check in was a breeze - very nice and easy. The hotel is having its main entrance remodeled at the moment - guess it will be great when finished but its a bit of a mess at the moment. Room was excellent, let down by a stunning bathroom with poor plumbing. The basin had a mixer tap that had a mind of its own - either too hot or too cold - really difficult to get the balance right - couldnt be bothered! Also it seemed like the sink was a bit blocked as the water backed up and took ages to clear. Mentioned this at checkout - wonder if anything was done about it!!! Didnt get a chance to try to restaurant as it had closed by the time I got back to the hotel after going out, but there were excellent late night eateries nearby so no problem. The hotel only offers valet parking, but this was not really a problem and the valet staff were very good. Great location, right in the centre of town and steps away from Westfield Horton Plaza if you want to go shopping! Slept well in the Westin bed, until woken up early by the VERY noisy neighbours in the suite next door.

Reviews.Title: “Xmas Holiday”
Reviews.Author: TrishnRic
Reviews.Content: Overall we were happy with the hotel. I'll give you the pros and cons. Pros: 1. Close to everything! Fine dining, shopping and sites were all within walking distance. 2. The doormen are awesome. Always friendly and made recommendations from places to eat and see. Always there to open the door for us with a smile. 3. Hot water! Ok I know but we've stayed at places with tepid water. The hotel actually has hot water. 4. Great rates for the area. Cons: 1. I understand they are undergoing a rennovation however I can't consider this a 4 star hotel. 2. Don't eat at Horton's downstairs. Way overpriced and the food wasn't great. Service wasn't that great there either. 3. While the room was clean, it could have been cleaner. Again, I can't see this as a 4 star hotel. 4. Flat pillows. Advertised as "heavenly beds" I wasn't impressed. Overall I probably would stay there again but we'd know what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “More going for it than just location”
Reviews.Author: Carol N
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Gaslamp in San Diego with a large party making the choice based on price, amenities and location. Little did we know it would turn out to be a great venue because of the can do, polite yet friendly attitude of staff. Because of the size of the party it was necessary to make changes, for instance people joined groups at breakfast or dinner unexpectedly; people paid for each other's rooms, etc. Not once did a request result in a sigh or negativ reaction. Best of all, the staff acted like they enjoyed each other and their job!!. This hotel is near the trolley line, walking distance from the railroad station and a short taxi ride from the airport and car rentals if necessary. Next time we're leaving the car at home!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Cleopatra_Jones
Reviews.Content: Checked in late after a looong trip from the East Coast. My room was clean and the hotel decor is relaxing...spa-like. The staff was courteous and pleasant. The bed was lush and refreshing in the standard Westin way. I love their dining menu because it indicates healthy menu choices. The food was delicious! I went down to the spotless whirpool and soaked my travel/work stress away. My room was very clean also with the exception of a few hairs in the bathroom - not cool. I highly recommend this hotel and location (great stores, beauty and walkability). Be warned that construction is taking place so there is a loudness factor.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Jacktraveler
Reviews.Content: Was here for business and only stayed one night but the room was great. Centrally located, very nice bar, friendly staff. Very solid and great value at less that 200/night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: kevin k
Reviews.Content: Great location is San Diego! Great shopping and dining within walking distance!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mephestophiles
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 days in early December. I arrived late one evening by taxi from the airport and had to be clear with the taxi driver which Westin I wanted to go to. On arrival the receptionist looked as if he was from Japan or maybe Korea and at first I had trouble understanding his English, or maybe he had trouble understanding mine, but we worked our way through the process. I had a nice room on the 8th floor overlooking the outdoor pool. (I never saw anyone using it.) I had some misgivings about the noise mentioned in other reports here. I can only say that I was never disturbed by any of the renovation work throughout my stay. The following morning I picked up a free paper from the reception area and on the combined advice of the two women receptionists who recommended various places, went off for breakfast. There are lots of places to eat within easy walking distance in this downtown area and the gaslamp district. In the room there was a coffee and tea making machine and a free bottle of water, which is a nice touch. My bedroom was a good size, comfortable and the room was immaculately cleaned every day. Whoever they employ for housekeeping is doing a great job and I hope they pay them well. There seemed to be frequent conferences held on the second floor. This was only marginally a problem when waiting in the morning for one of the 4 lifts. The choice of TV channels is amazing, although more from outside the USA for visitors from abroad would be a nice touch. (Europe, Chine, Arabia, etc.) The location is excellent easily walkable to USS Midway and other tourist sites, or the No 7 bus up to Balboa Park and the museums there. I usually walked down from the park to the hotel during the December Lights weekend, it was quicker and easy. There is a supermarket round the back a block or so away, if you want fresh fruit, or different drinks in your bedroom. The Horton mall next door was a bit of a disappointment, although much of the rest of architecture is both modern and stylish in San Diego. I have two minor quibbles. While the shower was excellent, I had asked for a bath (I know its a European habit, but I like to mull things over while sitting in hot water.) I had the impression from some of the photos on the hotel site that this was possible, but perhaps they were all in use. My bigger gripe is over the cost of using the internet. A two day use was charged at the same rate I pay for a month of high-speed broadband. The answer is that there are at least three branches of Starbucks within 10 minutes walk of the hotel, one of them near the entrance to the shopping mall next door to the hotel. For the price of a cup of coffee you can get on-line for free. Elsewhere in San Diego, it was possible to get on-line for free, but it does not cover the whole city. With the above minor caveat I would recommend this great hotel as an ideal spot for a visitor to use as his base, although be aware that outside on the streets there are always a few homeless people. I never felt threatened by any of them and when they asked for money it was always done very politely, regardless of whether I gave something, or not.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Nic7585
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was so convenient. We walked everywhere or took a cab. Cabs were $10.00 on average and readily available. The hotel was clean and located in a shopping district. There was CVS and Starbucks located next to the hotel. The hotel was really clean and the lobby was beautiful. If you're looking for a convenient, nice hotel that doesn't require you to get a rental car this is the place. Also the pool area was small but charming because it was on a roof top area.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: MicahV
Reviews.Content: aside from the contruction going on for the "facelift" of the lobby, had a good experience- bartenders were nice and informative, room/bed was comfortable (reccommend joining SPG for better room assignments) - good location for dining/entertainment on 4th and 5th streets and accessable to rail services- inexpensive cab ride to/from airport

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ynotstern
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great location to restaurants, nightlife, public transport and a short walk to the bay. The thing I liked most about the hotel was the ease of using nearby public transport.

Reviews.Title: “great stay at westin hotel gaslamp on broadway”
Reviews.Author: micklondonengland
Reviews.Content: had a great 5 nights at the westin 2-7 dec. had a room on 14th floor with bay view. fantastic beds, clean room every day.nice bathroom. great buffet breakfast over the weekend for $20 but during week it was menu breakfast.superb location.which you wont beat.the bar staff in the evening always rememberd our drinks from the previous night without asking. great concierge and reception staff..all in all a great stay and my return trip next year will be at this hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing downtown location”
Reviews.Author: Carly M
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived it was a little difficult to find the hotel due to the construction, but that wasn't an issue. We called the hotel and they directed us to the new entrance on 1st ave. We had no issue with the construction and it looks like its going to be amazing when its all done, cant wait to stay when its all done! The hotel staff was amazing, we had some questions about the area and Jeremy at the front desk was very helpful as well as AnneMarie at checkout. The food at Horton's was amazing and the drinks delicious :). The hotel is a few blocks away from the Gaslamp district with great restaurants and bars. The mall is right next door to the hotel as well. If your going to stay at a Westin in San Diego this is the one!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa J
Reviews.Content: I have to say that my wife and i had an incredible time! The staff was very helpful and friendly and the rooms were very nice, clean and comfortable. It was a wonderful experience. I can't wait to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown costs a pinch more”
Reviews.Author: Mysuccess029
Reviews.Content: I must first caution the reader that I tend to be a bit critical most of the time, with my complaints outweighing the praise. I think it just stems from my belief that most hotels are overpriced, and the "luxury" hotels often charge for all their flash but sacrifice important substance, like vital room features (comfort, amenities, etc.). Have you noticed some restaurants do this too? They are all too happy to charge you $100+ for a tasteless, skimpy meal, in the name of their trendy atmosphere. Priorities sometimes get mixed up! That's a little how I felt for the one night I stayed at the Westin Gaslamp Quarter in San Diego, CA. Here is my review in a supposed nutshell: Positives: I was on the 12th floor, which had a wonderful view of the skyline (especially at night), and the room's windows (which do crack open for fresh air) were large and attractively dressed, with drapes and scroll-down shades. The furniture, including a dark wood desk and bar area above the fridge, was clean and comfy and well-made. The room had a fairly large plasma style TV, but I did not turn it on. The shower was spacious with one of those new style curving curtains, a head that flowed well, a drain that did not clog, and high quality soap and shampoo. I also was impressed with the bathroom mirror, which had a florescent light built into the back--giving a mellow, romantic, yet well-lit glow around its frame, like a solar eclipse. The negatives: The woman at the check-in counter had some communication and customer service disabilities that forced me to use my diplomacy and communication talents when my colleague was getting frustrated over a room charge concern that she did not know how to handle, so a manager had to take over before it was resolved. The bathroom did not have a fan! Hello? Four star hotel? The bathroom sink also had low water pressure. I realize it's the 12th floor, but please solve this at some point. The fridge was extremely small and built into the console style bar with a large wood door, so every time you needed to get into the fridge you had to open this large wood door and then the fridge door. Kind of inconvenient and retarded, if you ask me. It's funny how luxury places also like to nickel and dime you for all the "extras." The small spring water bottle sitting atop the bar that looks complimentary and should be, is a mere $5 my friend. Sitting next to the bottle is the typical price list for all the overpriced snacks and drinks offered by many hotels that are supposed to be in the fridge, but we not in this case--nothing else was to be found. I can't think of any other annoying things I came across at this time, fortunately. It really wasn't all that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not so great construction”
Reviews.Author: rowheat
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. This hotel is right next to a major shopping mall. It is steps away from a convenient and inexpensive trolley line that can take you to an even better mall in 15 minutes. There are tons of nice restaurants around the the concierge is very helpful. Drawbacks are the construction happening at the front entrance, as well as the ridiculous price for breakfast there if not included in your room rate. My room was comfortable, but not exceptional. It was clean, but the alarm clock did not have an iPhone charger.

Reviews.Title: “Gaslamp location a plus”
Reviews.Author: Pjxones
Reviews.Content: Besides the construction this place has a lot of +'s. Pool, jacuzzi, workout facility and a very nice place for us to enjoy or conference. The staff was great, check in was easy. Casey as well as Rodrigo in the bar had plenty of great suggestions for entertainment in the Gaslamp. We will definitely be staying here again when we're in the San Diego area

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back...”
Reviews.Author: Andrew K
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay! We arrived later in the evening and had no dinner reservations, Jeremy at the front desk was very knowledgeable about local eats and directed us to a restaurant that had live music and great food. Needless to say it was a great evening out with my wife and even with such short notice for a room and eating, Jeremy @ the front desk handled it effortlessly.

Reviews.Title: “Must have sinned, heaven was gone.”
Reviews.Author: THEFATHER
Reviews.Content: Westin is fine, but the expected heavenly bed was Motel 6 model. Maybe the bed in the room we had was in the shop. We had great 15th floor room, great layout, but bed was disappointing. All the people that work at the Westin are great, friendly, and very helpful, they rate a 10.

Reviews.Title: “next to Horton Plaza”
Reviews.Author: Angie1118
Reviews.Content: Got deal through hotwire.com ($89) and another $20 off because I have entertainment book coupon. stayed for 1 night on 11/25/11. No contruction working on that day so I did not hear any noise. I stayed on 9th floor and could watch the construction scene from the window. Although I booked through hotwire, after telling staff I am SWG member, I still get free water. The night shift staff is very friendly and helpful. Got a local map and edward (sorry, I am not sure the name) showed me the parking garage so I only had to pay $10 flat fee without using valet service. (the parking garage is actually connected to horton plaza, I can walk to horton plaza parking and used the elevator to go to horton plaza. Also, the garage entrance is right next to hotel entrance) Typical westin hotel. I think the room is same size as the other Westin @ broadway which I stayed several months ago. Room has mini refrigerator so I can put mlik and fruit for next day breakfast. hotel also provides 3 starbucks coffee bag which you can use one cup coffee maker to make it. I think I will go back once the construcion is finished since it's a very convenient location . P.S: there is a CVS in horton plaza and Ralphs near by to shop some groceries swimming pool, jacuzzi and fitness center is on 3rd floor.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for improper charges”
Reviews.Author: gerardo174
Reviews.Content: We (my wife and I) stayed at the hotel to 11/27/11 11/24/11 we had a little fear because in trip advisor page we saw that the hotel made improper charges. Well our worst fears came true, the 24/11/11 we request for room service that we canceled 2 minutes later because we prefered dining out the hotel as the room service is very slow 3 more minutes later somebody called us to say that I may pay for the none receipt service because I cancelled thirty minutes after my first call, I tried to fix the problem saying what happened but practically they told me I was lying. In general the hotel is good without being by far the best hotel I have ever stayed is nothing special, very well located and that´s all; I recommend you to be very careful whit this hotel because actually they make improper and unauthorized charges.

Reviews.Title: “A lot of issues ...”
Reviews.Author: Leesw8
Reviews.Content: I was expecting to write a glowing report of this hotel - after all the location cannot be beaten, right next to Horton Plaza, walking distance to the sea front, etc. BUT that's where it stopped. The hotel is under such construction work, that you seem to enter through a side door and there is no public space other than a noisy bar and grill on the ground floor. I'm sure it will be lovely when its finished next year, but not at the moment. I also had issues with housekeeping - these have been reported to the hotel management and I did receive a night's stay refunded as a result. When I got to my room - very nice room - I found no remote control. Annoying but not deal breaking. I reported it and one was placed in my room whilst I was out to dinner. The main issue was with water penetration to the room one night. I reported the issue at 3.30am, when it had woken me up and was told it was a broken pipe. There was nothing at that hour which could be done except put down towels to soak up water. You then lie there awake and listen to the dripping until you eventually fall asleep again. I also disliked paying for internet - so didn't. Horton Plaza has free wifi so head next door. The network showed up on available networks whilst in the hotel too, but my netbook couldn't connect. Another expense is valet parking at $32 per night plus taxes with no alternative self-park option. I would return to the hotel once I knew it was finished, but currently there are better hotels in the city and I'd wished I'd stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Very unpleasant stay at Westin Gaslamp qtr”
Reviews.Author: IVsystem
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel can not be beaten, but that was about the only thing pleasant about our recent stay at this property. We requested for a connecting room when we booked, and we didn't get it. Asked again to see if there is any (we were traveling with 2 little kids and connecting rooms were essential), and we were told that there is none available. So we took 2 rooms right next to each other on the 9th floor and as soon as we got off from the elevator on the 9th, it smelled like someone has been smoking on the floor for hours. It was so bad. We got into our room and noticed the smell was leaking into our room, so we called Service Exp. and asked for a room change. We were then told that there is a connecting room and were told that someone is bein sent with new sets of keys. We waited for about good 20 minutes and no one came. I decided to just go down to the front rest and get new keys myself and I did. This lady at the front was exceptionally friendly and helpful unlike the guy who checked us in. We went to our new connecting room on 5th floor and we were waiting for a baby crib which we have requested. Good 20 minutes passed and no one came. Called the front and they didn't know about the crib request so they made a request for us. After all this stressful hassle, realized that check in and settling down took us about 2 and a half painful hours. And then later in the evening, we discovered that the heater in one of our rooms were not working. Someone was sent to fix it but it still didn't work. Called the front again and were informed that they don't have parts to get it fixed, and they can give us more blankets. Okay, I've had it up to my head and didn't wanted to let all the troubles get to me, but this is just down right ridiculous. Front staff asked if we want to move to a different room, but we were also told that connecting rooms are all taken. Since we were traveling with little kids we needed connecting rooms and working ac/heating, so I have asked if they have a portable heater for us to use, and they said no. Asked again if there's anything the hotel can do to get this situation corrected, and I was told "no". I understand sometimes things go wrong and few makes mistakes but there's no excuse for not doing the best to have issues resolved. This by far is definitely one of the worst hotel experience I have in many many years of traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: thumbelina89316
Reviews.Content: We had initially been booked at the US grant, however, due to unknown circumstances at that hotel, our reservations were moved to the Westin. The staff was extremely helpful with the transfer and were very accommodating and helpful throughout our trip. There was heavy construction around the hotel, but it didn't seem to be an issue with our stay. I would highly recommend this hotel, especially if you can get a room on the higher floors to get a great view of downtown San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: NJOY909
Reviews.Content: The staff and accommodations were great. The room was totally renovated and very nice. We really enjoyed the pool, gym and jacuzzi area. Small construction going on outside. Good food and entertainment. We ate at the French Bistro and hotel restaurant. Both were reasonable price and really good food. We came down for the Chargers/Raiders game and Veterans Day. We had free street parking from Thursday night til Saturday morning right outside the hotel because it was federal holiday. We could see our car out of our hotel window a few floors above the pool. We paid 4bucks for 9hrs. WONDERFUL!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel -- Amazing Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie S
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel because of a recommendation from one of my girlfriends who had stayed there in September with her husband and enjoyed it. I have to say that this was one of the best hotel experiences. Despite the huge amount of construction that was going on, as they're re-doing the entry of the hotel, our stay was amazing. The concierge desk was spot on with restaurant recommendations and they even gave us a few discounts on some sightseeing tours. The pool is great and the hot tub is even better! Last but not least, the location of the hotel is central, close to Balboa park, the Zoo, the waterfront and the Gaslamp Quarter. Would go back anytime.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bostona
Reviews.Content: Stayed there during renovations for 3 night in november, No major disruptions, staff was very nice and concierge extremely helpful. The entrance is now a smaller side door but there's plenty of people there to direct you and ask you if you need anything. Room was spacious and very clean. The Oakland Raiders were staying there and it was exciting, as a football fan, to run into some players in the elevators!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff do a poor job managing construction”
Reviews.Author: Jeff B
Reviews.Content: The hotel likely is a very nice hotel when there is not construction. The meeting rooms on the second floor were filled with the smell of diesel, a complete water shutdown that lasted more than an hour longer than the 2 hours originally allotted (3 hours without a restroom or running water is UNACCEPTABLE), lots of construction noise, and the cleanliness of the room was questionable: with a large stain on the carpet, and something amiss with the restroom tile (seemingly a film of mold or grout that was not removed cleaned off). When I called to complain about the extended length of the water shutdown, the staff knew nothing about it and never got back in contact with me to tell the service returned to normal. Nor did they offer alternative locations for guests to use the facilities, wash their hands, or any bottled water. I had several migraines from the diesel fumes in the meeting spaces and a very difficult time paying attention or relaxing with all the noise. The hotel really wasn't worth the money for the inconvenience and poor cleanliness/lack of concern demonstrated by the Westin staff. I will be looking to stay elsewhere when I return to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Would be 5 star, but construction right now is a mess”
Reviews.Author: Tawas70
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel. Great location. Great staff. Clean very comfortable rooms. It is very pricey. There is a major construction project going on right now. The banging and thumping start at 8am. If you are on business not a problem, but to escape and sleep in avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: OBRIENFM
Reviews.Content: I was a guest at Westin Gaslamp San Diego this past weekend & am writing to commend 2 parking valets, Tim & Greg. Surely they should be recognized for their impeccable behavior & service. It was a pleasure working with them.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Good Service, Clean, Comfortable Room”
Reviews.Author: FoxyBoomer
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a pleasure. Located in a convenient spot right next to Horton Plaza shopping, the Gaslamp Quarter and easy walk to convention center and Seaport Village. The room was clean and comfortable with a small refrigerator, coffee pot, large flat screen TV. Lovely pool area. Would give it five stars if it weren't for the construction happening in part of the hotel. They are re-doing the front and jackhammer noise and vibration were a bit annoying in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Just like home”
Reviews.Author: reviewing40
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 6 day vacation in San Diego. The hotel staff was so accommodating that we felt right at home. We were there during the World Series, and being Texas Rangers fans, wanted to watch every game.The Horton's Bar staff was very accommodating, and reserved a table for us right up front by the big TV. One night we played Scrabble in the bar. Service was always friendly and prompt. The buffet breakfasts were fresh and delicious. The hotel was under renovation, and everyone was constantly apologizing, but because of the friendliness of the hotel staff, we hardly noticed it. We loved the location, with all the wonderful restaurants right outside the hotel door, and the outdoor shopping mall. I really want to go back when the renovation is completed, as then it will be really beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: graham73
Reviews.Content: First time in CALIFORNIA joint birthday and retIrement. We stayed 6 nights at the WESTIN and loved every minute. The staff went out of their way to make our stay memorable.
