We cant thank them enough.Special mention for PANICHA in the restaurant,delightful and very efficient.The hotel is in a great position close to restaurants,shops,Embarcadero. Recommend the historic trolley tour and tour of USS MIDWAY also enjoyed Balbao Park and Seaport Village. A big thank you to all at the WESTIN. We would love to return one day

Reviews.Title: “So nice for a night out in the gaslamp”
Reviews.Author: VacaGypsy
Reviews.Content: Very modern, clean hotel. We were impressed with the area, staff, and hotel. Lots of shops, dining within walking distance. Rooftop pool is nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great option”
Reviews.Author: JRo70
Reviews.Content: I've stayed twice at the Westin on recent business trips, and have enjoyed the location and amenities. The hotel is located downtown, near the Gaslamp quarter and within walking distance of other attractions. The hotel itself is standard, with a restaurant, gym, pool and so on. The restaurant's breakfasts are excellent. The rooms are comfortably appointed. I had problems with the hotel's Internet access on one trip, and had to wait a half hour for the valets to fetch my rental car one evening, causing me to arrive late to a dinner meeting. Another issue: construction nearby has woken me up in the morning. Yet generally, the staff have been helpful and attentive. I'd recommend this hotel for its location and general high quality, but not for charm.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: travelnice7
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 nights in September in this hotel. Westin promotes the idea of a relaxing stay and quite succeeds in it. It is located in the center of the business quarter and just a few minutes of walking from downtown The standard room was modern and very spacious. The breakfast is decent, the staff polite and helpful. There is an outside pool and a gym. A minor drawback is that wi-fi was free on the ground floor only, and quite expensive for a 1-day use. Otherwise - very mice place to stay both for business and vacations.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an unbeatable location.”
Reviews.Author: James C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Westin Gaslamp during a recent visit to San Diego. It was one of the most comfortable hotel stays we've had in quite some time. Good amenities, perfect location, and a very warm staff. We were particularly impressed with our server Michelle at Horton's Bar and Grill. I generally try to avoid hotel restaurants, but she made me rethink that bias with her superior customer service. Her recommendations for the Horton's menu and later the Gaslamp nightlife were spot on. We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Gaslamp Quarter”
Reviews.Author: fvrbtmn
Reviews.Content: This is a much nicer than the other Westin a couple blocks away. The staff, the reception area, the fitness center and the pool were all better. The hotel is located right next to the shopping mall. You can walk to all the entertainment and dining spots in Gaslamp quarter within minutes. If you are baseball fan, PETCO park s nearby. Also, stop by Kansas BBQ where they just celebrated 2th anniversary of the filming of "Top Gun" - Yes the one with Tom Cruise!

Reviews.Title: “Great property, needs some work”
Reviews.Author: foxyfit4
Reviews.Content: As usually, standard of service at a Starwoods property was great. Location was great - walking distance from everything. Hotel could use some renovations/upgrades.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: deniseann26
Reviews.Content: Beware of front entrance construction for the next few weeks. My boyfriend and I stayed at this Westin October 2011 for 6 nights in an Executive King room. It was a larger room with a wonderful king bed, but our view was that of a wall; request a high floor. All their staff was great, professional and friendly! The 3rd fl pool was small but clean and warm, the hot tub was little, and the workout room was brand new. Hotel is just a block from 5th street were you will find tons a restaurants/bars, and is attached to a shopping mall. Recommend taking the Historic Trolley for a day, a great hop-on/off tour. Also, USS Midway is within walking distance, recommend visiting during a weekday and spending a few hours.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: stephenday50
Reviews.Content: Great location to all the restaurants. Stayed in room 510 which overlooked the pool. Forgot deodorant and the lady at front desk heard me and brought one to me. Starbucks in the hotel didn't make a good coffee but there is a real Starbucks about two minutes from the hotel as well as a Petes. Great deal good location

Reviews.Title: “a wounded warrior hotel”
Reviews.Author: jdupee
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent a whole week at the Westin Gaslamp visiting our son, a wounded warrior Marine, at the Naval Medical Center San Diego. We were very well treated, enjoyed eating at the restaurant and the cafe in the hotel, used the pool and enjoyed the beautiful views. The hotel is located in a marvelous area filled with great restaurants, yet is close to the waterfront, Balboa Park and the Medical Center. We highly recommend this hotel both for it's amenities and for it's kindness toward the families of our service men and women. JD

Reviews.Title: “Great location for shopping, nightlife and restaurants!”
Reviews.Author: kamikidd
Reviews.Content: Was here for a conference and really enjoyed the location. Very clean property despite some of the minor improvements being made. Only problem I had was asking for additional service ( towels during turn down) was ignored along with that evenings turn down was never performed. The other minor problem was as a platinum member I couldn't arrange for/ recieve a king bed. Note: this property does not have an elite lounge or free breakfast for platinum/ gold members. There is a great patio off the fourth floor for smokers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room and Location”
Reviews.Author: Emily G
Reviews.Content: I just had the pleasure of staying at the Westin Gaslamp this past weekend. Everything from the moment I pulled up to the valet to the check out process was handled extremely professional and with great service. Our room was ready as soon as we arrived even though it was before check in and the front desk was very friendly and helpful with a map of the area. Our room service was speedy and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BrianFromSantaMonica
Reviews.Content: We went to San Diego to meet our son, a Navy pilot in town for the weekend. We also wanted to be located in the Gaslamp Quarter because of access to a lot of great sights and restaurants in walking distance. The Westin Gaslamp Quarter was a good choice for our requirements, though perhaps not a place to rave about. Good room, quiet, great location. The sort of place you can base your expeditions out of, not as much a place that you would seek as a destination if that makes sense. Drinks at the bar are pricey. I ordered a sherry for my wife but they didn't have any. Their port selection was restricted to a Fonsecu, but I got it for her and a Lagavulin for me. Price - $28 - hmm.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Decat08
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Westin while in San Diego for a conference (conference was held at a different location). Without exception, the staff I encountered were friendly and helpful. The room was beautiful and clean, and I appreciated the ability to get Starwood points in exchange for not having my linens replaced every day. Even better, my room was ready when I arrived at 11 a.m., so I didn't have to worry about stowing my luggage for a few hours while I attended the first session of my conference. I paid for all three nights in advance, and I don't know if it affected the room I was given (I doubt it), but I had a top-floor room well away from elevators, so I was never bothered by noise during my stay. Plus, I had a great view of the bay! FYI, though this Westin doesn't have an airport shuttle, another one about 2 blocks away does, and you are allowed to use it. If my travels ever bring me back to San Diego, staying here will be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KingPickle98
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent an anniversary at this hotel last weekend. Great hotel, prefect location and 16th floor oversized room with a view of the bay. Attentive staff and great Concierge Catherine, who helped up with reservations, and, best of all, a bottle of Champaign and chocolates.

Reviews.Title: “Very Convenient”
Reviews.Author: gsuzuki
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just completed a four night stay at the Westin Gaslamp hotel and we both were very happy with the service. There was couple things that we did not like, but it wasn't anything to get mad about. Here we go: Checking In: After a overnight flight from Honolulu, we arrived at the hotel at about 10:00 a.m. We took the Super Shuttle from the airport and it took about 15 minutes from the airport to the hotel (The time included dropping some passengers at other hotels). As other reviewers have said, make sure you inform the driver that you want to go to the Westin next to Horton Shopping mall because there are two Westin's in San Diego. Checking in was a breeze, even though we got in a little early, our room was ready. From the minute we arrived at the hotel, everyone from the valets, the doorperson, the people at the front desk always welcomed you. The person helping us informed we were on a room on the 4th floor. I was hoping to be in a room a little higher, but I did not mention anything. Room: The room we had was right near the elevator. Surprisingly, it was not the noisy at night from the other guests walking by. The room was pretty spacious considering the hotel is in the downtown district. There is a little dorm size refrigerator and a work desk, plus a sofa. The bed was very good, I guess you could say it was "Heavenly". Location: The Westin is in a perfect location (to me). It is located right next door to Horton Shopping Plaza where there are quite a few number of stores and food court restaurants. Yes, the layout is a little different compared to other regular malls, but once you know where to go, it is pretty easy. There is a CVS on the very ground floor and a Starbucks if you need to get any items for the room. On the other side of the mall, right across Nordstrom is a pretty big size Ralphs Market. My wife and I bought some drinks and food because the Westin does not offer a complimentary breakfast. On the opposite side of the mall is 4th street and this is the edge of the Gaslamp District. This area goes on 4th, 5th, and 6th street and this is where a lot of restaurant, bars, and other stores are located. Since the hotel is not located right on the Gaslamp District, I did not hear any of the noise from this area. The convention center and Petco Park is located about a 15 minute walk. If you do not want to walk, the public trolley has a stop about a block over and the trolley will take you all over San Diego. Restaurants: There was couple restaurants (I did not go into any of them) and there is a lounge right off the lobby. Pool & Exercise Room: The person at the front desk said there is one, I did not check it out. Business Center: There are couple computers to use located in one of the restuarants. I noticed when the resturant was closed, the door was locked. If you wanted to use the computer after the restaurant closed, I'm not sure how this would be done. Negatives: Parking: To valet park (only option) was $32 per day. This was kind of high, so my wife and I only rented a car on our last night. We parked on the street, just make sure you read the signs because there are street cleaining on certain mornings. Internet access: The charge is $9.95 per 24 hour period. I wish this was included in the price of the room. There is free internet service in the lobby area. The internet service was adequate for what I was doing. Street work: On the last night, there was some street work right outside the hotel. We could hear a loud rumbling sound from about 11:00 pm to about 12:00 midnight. Not something you want to hear when you have to wake up at 3:00 am to catch a flight. This was the time when I wished the room was on a higher floor. Advice: Parking: The Horton Plaza Mall will validate your parking ticket, if you park in their garage, for 3 hours. You do not have to buy anything, you just have to find the parking valtidation machine. This is helpful especially if you don't pay for the hotel parking and you need to freshen up before leaving again at night. If you park overnight, the costs is about $60. Finding the Hotel: The Westin is located right next to the NBC and AT&T building. If you get lost, just look for one of these buildings and you will find the Westin. Overall, the Westin is a very good place to stay. With the exception of the high parking price, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Employee Janine at the Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Cowgirlsofia
Reviews.Content: Janine was everything we could have asked as a server. We had dinner at the hotel restaurant on Friday night and service was excellent for a group of 11 ladies there for a bachelorette party! The next morning we had the restaruant's breakfast buffet! Not only was the food excellent, but Janine was amazing, she remembered most of our rooms from the night before. Because she gave us such excellent service we ate almost all of our meals there and she not only remembered our rooms #'s, but remembered our drinks too! She amazed us! Excellent Service!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Anna W
Reviews.Content: When you think of the Westin high quality comes to mind, especially for the price you pay. I was disappointed in the comfort of our deluxe double room. The beds were were 2 double beds and while the comforter was nice it wasn't the heavenly bed you get at the Marriott for less. The quality of the furniture was similar to what you see at Ikea. The bar's alcohol selection was extremely small considering that I was there for a formal dinner with 400 other guests. My recommendation is to not be fooled by this Westin at least not for the price. I've stayed at a few Westin's and this one leaves you shaking your head at what they don't provide.

Reviews.Title: “great san diego weekend spot”
Reviews.Author: Mary Kay L
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms, comfy beds and it looks like an update is coming in the public areas. It is in a great area for walking, close to everything downtown. The onsite coffee shop is convenient and reasonable, Panicha and Nijad took great care of us.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Staff I Have Ever Encountered!”
Reviews.Author: Newssss
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel unless you want to be treated like a criminal, have unauthorized charges placed on your credit card, and deal with a totally incompetent front desk staff and on-call "supervisor". I came to this hotel to celebrate my birthday weekend with my best friend. The room was booked and "prepaid" by a reputable travel agency. I received a confirmation email from Westin saying it was prepaid. When we checked in, the clerk confirmed again that the room was prepaid and just needed a credit card for "incidentals." However when we went to check out 3 DAYS LATER, the front desk tried to charge my friend's credit card nearly $500 for the entire amount for the room. They claimed the credit card used to pay for the room was rejected and announced in front of several other hotel guests at the front desk that it was a "stolen credit card." We assured them that a reputable travel agency backed by a huge bank in North America surely was not using a stolen credit card to book rooms. We were horrified by this treatment. I could not believe no problem about the prepaid room had been mentioned sooner. Instead, I was left to deal with this upon checkout on my birthday - forcing me to nearly miss my flight to Las Vegas to meet my husband. I finally got ahold of the travel agency, which assured me the room had indeed been paid. The travel agent asked to speak to the front desk clerk at the hotel. I handed over my cell phone to the clerk who took my phone to a back room, so the travel agent could speak to the "supervisor" on duty. Fifteen minutes later, this so-called "supervisor" emerged and said everything had been taken care of and the only charges that would appear on my friend's credit card would be for parking. My friend made it clear that parking would be the only charges she would authorize on her card. Finally, we managed to leave the hotel and I barely made my flight. Three days later, my friend checks her credit card statement and sees the Westin Gaslamp STILL charged $488 in room charges to her credit card. This was absolutely unbelievable to me. The last we heard from the "supervisor" at the hotel was that everything was fine. If something still went wrong after that point, someone should have called and notified me! Instead, they just went ahead and charged $488 in unauthorized charges to my friend's card. I called the travel agency back and they were HORRIFIED. They assured me that they had proof that the room had been paid for with the agency's credit card. They could not understand what the hotel was doing. After several calls to the accounting department at the hotel, the Westin Gaslamp finally reversed the charges to my friend's card. I never recieved any explanation or apology from hotel management. The hotel staff was completely inept and unprofessional. I have always loved Westin hotels. That is why I chose to celebrate my birthday weekend at this Westin. However, after this experience I may never return to a Westin again. I know one thing for sure - I will NEVER go back to the Westin Gaslamp!

Reviews.Title: “the most help we have ever received on a trip...”
Reviews.Author: Gloria753
Reviews.Content: We were so impressed with the Westin gaslamp hotel we want to name names: People who helped us were: Dawn Burke , Danielle Anderson, Tony Gallente, Guy Gallagher, Hector Lazios, Jesus Villa-Flores and Ramon J. Others were all the valet parking people...all the bellman...and all the housekeepers.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday”
Reviews.Author: sillyputty2ma
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a great time in San Diego. The hotel was beautiful and the staff was very welcoming and helpful. We happened to be there when there was a major power outage and the staff made us feel very safe and knew exactly what to do. We were even escorted down 8 flights of stairs, so we can go out. The rooms were very clean and the beds were heavenly. If there is one thing that I would have like more of, was lighting in the room. I had to request another floor lamp because I found the room not bright enough at days end. Also, can use extra towel hooks in the bathroom to hang up stuff. But, overall, I would recommend this hotel, We had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms...”
Reviews.Author: venturer
Reviews.Content: After an eleven hour flight it was bliss to sink into lovely comfortable beds with good quality sheets. The room was spotless, as was the bathroom, and both were well equiped. The hotel is in a good location being within walking distance of the Gaslamp district and Seaport.

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: mvpoc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a fun weekend with my family this summer. I have stayed here before and highly recommend it for business or pleasure. Even though, the Gas Lamp quarter is mostly for adults in the evening, we walked everywhere and ate dinner at Buca de Bepo, perfect place to dine with kids. The staff here is excellent and took very good care of us. The hotel is next to Horton Plaza which has shops fast food and movies. There is also a CVS drugstore next door which makes it nice to buy snacks and anything you forgot for the family. The pool is small but the kids loved it. The rooms are great, love having starbucks coffee in the room. I would stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a staycation”
Reviews.Author: haberdasher_99
Reviews.Content: Rooms and floors were recently recarpeted. Room was clean. Checking in was a good experience. Hotel bar is nice with a decent selection of beers. Wings were also good in the bar. Bed slept well as usual. Noise from other parts of the hotel were minimal if not existent. We stayed over the labor day weekend 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Dog friendly and great amenities”
Reviews.Author: travellinglgb
Reviews.Content: Loved the large size of the standard room, with nicely done bathroom. Everything was clean and comfortable. Loved that they are dog friendly. It was a little tough to trot the dog over to a potty area. My dog did not want to go on the artificial turf, which was suggested as the closests place. We had to hunt for a garden area outside of office buildings. The location was ideal. Shopping, dining and walking distance to the waterfront made this little pleasure trip very convenient. There was a slight smell of cigarette smoke coming from the ventilation ducts though. I would have thought all the non-smoking rooms would have been separated from the smoking rooms better.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Surprises”
Reviews.Author: Seesuze
Reviews.Content: The Westin Gaslamp made my San Diego trip with my boyfriend feel first class. We were upgraded into one of their bi-level suites which was a complete surprise to me. The room was the size of a house with a dining room, kitchen, living room, long staircase, overflow jet tub, steam shower, Heavenly bed, and two TVs. We were treated very well which made it easy for us to relax. We ordered breakfast from roomservice and the food was excellent. Also, the hotel was very helpful with getting us drivers and taxis when we needed them. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: sean p
Reviews.Content: The best spot to be clean quiet, near all your travel spots. Cathrine B the concierge woman is so helpfull. I`ll be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean property for a wedding block”
Reviews.Author: robwat23
Reviews.Content: We are having a destination wedding in San Diego and stayed at this Westin with the possibility of having our out of town wedding guests stay at this hotel. This hotel recently changed their rooms, which have a nice, warm relaxing feel to them. They are getting ready to do a major renovation to their lobby. The staff was very helpful and the location is absolutely superb.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TOB-Philly
Reviews.Content: Had much higher expectations of this Westin property. It was just ok. Room size was adequate. Clean. Check in went smooth. Connecting rooms as requested. Tough to say anything was wrong; just not 'special'. Lobby was not inviting. No real area to relax- just come in the hotel go to the elevator. Pool was small and a bit crowded. Plenty of towels and lounge chairs and having an outside roof pool is nice- just small. Gym was just remodelled so brand new equipment and super clean. Plenty of shopping, restaurants, PETCO park etc all within walking distance. Very short drive to Zoo and easy on/off to the freeway. Basically average and completely acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet and Comforfable”
Reviews.Author: MrKite58
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin recently for business. The hotel is well located on the edge of the Gaslamp District, away from the noise and bustle, but a short one block walk to all of the action. Many restaurants to choose from within a few minutes walk. The rooms were very nice, exceptionally clean and the beds were very comfortable. Flat screen TV with modern A/V hookups and convenient power sources for plugging in laptops, phone chargers, etc. The desk area is well designed and had a comfortable chair. For kicking back, there was a nice easy chair. The meeting rooms were great; large and clean with modern a/v equipment. The food and coffee service was excellent. I guess my only complaint, although complaint is too harsh a word in this case, would be the lack of a lounge in the hotel where you could have a drink, relax and watch a ballgame, etc. Even though there are hundreds of bars and restaraunts just outside, sometimes you just want to hang at the hotel...:) Overall, a very nice hotel for business or pleasure. I would definitely stay here again..

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: schmelke1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business and found the hotel, rooms, etc very nice. The valet staff was outstanding -- really set the tone for the hotel and it was great not having to wait at all - they were very quick retrieving cars, good with directions, recommendations etc. Rooms were nice, great beds, nice bathroom. So all positives about the hotel. Not so positive about the neighborhood. The mall next door is strange and poorly conceived. But there is a Panera and a CVS right nearby and lots of conveniences. I have never seen so many homeless people per square foot -- even in NY. I did not feel unsafe but it was just very sad to see how many people were living on the streets - there was an entire tent camp a number of blocks away (you'd have to be driving to see it) and I found the Gaslamp area generally seedy although it did not seem dangerous.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: caramia732
Reviews.Content: My husband, my 2 teenage kids and I stayed here on our trip to San Diego in May. It was a very nice hotel and the staff was really pleasant. The bartender was friendly and gave us tips about restaurants and places to see. We had a great time. But the room was quite small. We had booked a room online. It was supposed to sleep 4, but had only 2 double beds. Since my teens are a boy and a girl, I needed more. I asked but there weren't any larger, or additional, rooms available. When we asked for a rol-away bed, we were told that roll-away beds violate the law. No sofas in the rooms either. Wish I had known when I booked.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for couples to relax”
Reviews.Author: DaveLevine
Reviews.Content: A romantic getaway brought my wife and I to San Diego. On advice from friends we stayed at the Westin due to it's centralized location and easy access to explore SD's amenities. What we did expect was great weather, what we did not expect was such a pleasant hotel experience. The rooms are beautiful and quiet, the only drawback being lack of internet, but the service is what impressed us most. The lobby and maid staff were very polite and attended to our every need. The bar was a little pricey, but that was forgivable do to our waitress. I think her name was Michele, she was a wealth of information and always had a bright smile that helped us wind down from exhaustive days of tourist activities. On her recommendation we checked out a Padres game and had a blast. It was just a short walk from the hotel. We will stay here again on our next visit to SD.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel...perfect location”
Reviews.Author: traveleveryweek
Reviews.Content: We stayed in August with my wife and 3 kids. We booked 2 rooms (older kids are 16 and 21) and as an spg plat. member, we were upgraded to a junior suite, with a room next door for the boys. The rooms seemed modern and new enough. Both had refrigerators (helpful when you eat out every night and have leftovers) and plenty of room. The suite had a wet bar, small dining area and balcony. Very nice. But, the real draw with this hotel is the location. You're right in the middle of the gaslamp district and everything it has to offer. If you're looking for a nice quiet and relaxing trip...this isn't the place. If you're active, love eating out, love people watching, etc., this is your place! Only negative I have is that the pool area isn't much to speak of. But again, this really isn't a pool type of resort, so no points deducted for that.

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel - go near seaport for tourists”
Reviews.Author: Motley2112
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel $32 dollars for parking, and a srley valet Parker is a bit shocking. A city centre location is not great ad a tourist. Lots of down and outs in the area. Pool good, although decorating and no gym on site due to renovations. Hotel staff very helpful. Advise was really good. Modern room, small beds. Had to pay for in room internet, which I'd the first time in 8 hotels I have had to do this. Seafront is pros key a better place for a family/tourist destination.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: trucker64
Reviews.Content: We had no complaints with out stay. Good location for downtown activities, attached to Horton Plaza for shopping. Loved the empty refrigerator for us to use. Only downside is the parking fees but if you want to stay downtown it looks like all the hotels charge them. Valet was quick.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel. Good Location”
Reviews.Author: travelrevi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March and really liked it. We travel a lot for business and personal. This hotel stands up to Westin standards which are nice but not as high as they once were. Westins have been caught up to by nicer Hiltons, Hyatt and some nicer Marriott properties. At this level it is all about value. The hotel was clean as were the rooms and the location was nice. The service was adequate. I would stay again based on competitive pricing.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel & great staff!”
Reviews.Author: thomkaySJ
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Westin Gaslamp just recently... Although we used frequent flyer miles for our stay, we were treated like royalty. Both the hotel and the restaurant staffs were very professional and helpful through out our stay. The room was spacious, clean, and very comfortable. Without question, on our next trip to San Diego we would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Staff clearly aims to please...even smallest problem corrected”
Reviews.Author: dsnider2006
Reviews.Content: First the money stuff- we booked the room for $115/night for a 3-night stay, which I was delighted by. Valet parking is $32 a day (more about that later). This hotel DOES charge for internet in the rooms, but if you're cheap like me, you can get 30 min. of free internet per day in the lobby. In fact, you can go downstairs, get the code, come back up to your room and spend the remainder of your 30 minutes there! You can get a $5 coupon for the hotel restaurants or a credit to your bill every day that you don't have housekeeping. Now the rest-From check-in until check-out, the service at this hotel was superb. The front desk was friendly and courteous, although I did have to ask twice to have a baby crib brought up to my room. Although the website states that you cannot have a crib in the double room, the front desk provided one at no charge. The rooms are large, the beds are nice (not sure if they're heavenly, but nice) and the concierge is extremely knowledgeable. I got a really awesome, cheap pedicure by listening to her rather than just going to the closest nail spa. We had a problem with the valet being slow (8-10 min) to get our car twice. As a result, we got that days' valet parking FREE! By and large, the valets were professional, but the newbies were clearly new and slowed the others down asking questions and generally getting in the way. Since we refused housekeeping, we got $10 worth of coupons and used them at the Starbucks cafe in the lobby for breakfast the morning we checked out. So, we got free Starbucks coffee and pastries, on top of a ridiculously cheap room and discounted parking.

Reviews.Title: “"Perfect service, they even organized a rental bike"”
Reviews.Author: Daniel K
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed San Diego by bike every evening, hotel service was perfect in organizing me a nice bike with everything needed, the helmet, lock, lights included, and off it went to Point Loma in an evening trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and a relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: will b
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Westin. All staff were friendly and helpful, but the star was Tom, the concierge whose advice helped us squeeze the most out of the area. We had 2 kids with us , but the room was plenty big enough and the room service was really good value. We also enjoyed the relaxed breakfast buffet. Thanks to everyone for providing a great end to our Californian adventure!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it : )”
Reviews.Author: CricketBellaRose
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a good choice.. While it was a lot further to walk to the convention center (in heels) I really didn't mind.. The area felt safe and it was a beautiful walk.. After the big supper's out on the town, I highly recommend the walk back to settle the stomach and feel less quilty ; ) The bed was AMAZING! We were on the 16th floor.. View was nice.. I LOVED the Concierge.. I didn't get her name, but she had an adorable accident and was MOST helpful.. PLUS she told my boyfriend how "simply adorable" she thought I was because I was trying to remember a resturant I saw, and the only thing I could remember was a lobster sunning itself in a lounge chair on a wall mural. She thought that was pretty funny AND she figured out the resturant... Tv was big.. Never much on, but not really the hotel's fault. All in all I was happy with it.. Close to the market.. The ONLY thing I would have liked to have had was a microwave... We had leftovers that couldn't be heated up. 5 Stars * * * * *

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: reedprincess
Reviews.Content: I loved the Westin Gaslamp! I was traveling for 2 days getting to SD and must have looked as frazzled as I felt when I finally arrived at the hotel and everyone treated me like a queen - from the valet guys all the way through to check-in - these folks could not do enough to help me out! The staff was extremely friendly throughout the stay and were very helpful - even down to a manager coming up to let me back in my room after I locked myself out! Maria at the front desk was amazing, got me into my room right away, the bellboy was very helpful and friendly - I really felt welcomed and valued as a guest and as an SPG member. The room was beautiful - and huge! I was in an executive room and it was huge! I loved the space and the multi-function table, and the in-room amaneities were excellent - I took them with me for later in my trip! Loved the free water, loved the big TV and bed - as always - was ridiculously comfortable. I do love those heavenly beds! Location is great - walking distance to shopping, entertainment, dining of all kinds - great view of Coronado Bay Bridge from my room, it was wonderful. All in all - an excellent stay! Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great base camp while exploring in and around San Diego”
Reviews.Author: BetweenBars
Reviews.Content: The place was great. We stayed here for 2 nights while exploring san diego and the surrounding area. Everything, from the check in to valet to the rooms, was way above average. Very friendly and helpful staff all around. The hotel is right in the heart of the gaslamp district. We will definitely be staying here again. Unfortunately, it costs 32 dollars a night to park your vehicle, but what do you expect for downtown san diego. The hot tub on the roof was an added bonus. I wish it was warm enough to use the pool. These were the first 2nights of a roadtrip to san francisco, and the hotel was the cheapest and nicest we stayed at on an 8 night trip. Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: goyumago
Reviews.Content: From arrival to departure the entire staff was friendly, helpful and very customer service oriented. This is a place to stay not only in the gaslamp district but also in San Diego proper. With walking distance to Midway and Seaport village. Extremely enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Central to downtown & Gas Lamp core; blocks from Convention Centre”
Reviews.Author: holidayingfromCanada
Reviews.Content: Room was very comfortable, with all amenities....nice size and good view too! Great location, and well priced - using online promotions to book ahead. Would definitely stay here again on next trip! Friendly and helpful staff made stay a welcome and pleasant experience all round!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Ruth P
Reviews.Content: Our anniversary/birthday trip to San Diego was probably the most relaxing and carefree get-aways we have ever had. The room was beautiful and comfortable. The Concierge, Julianne Pion, was so very kind and helpful! She went out of her way to locate special surprises requested by our children, and also recommended wonderful resturants, made the reservations and even had the restaraunts manager check on how we were doing. When we discovered how expensive the parking on the hotel site would be, the Valet gave us options that were very convienient and perfectly safe for our vehicle. I would highly recommend Westin Gaslamp in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Steve M
Reviews.Content: My family of four (2 teenage sons) my wife & I on the 15th floor & the boys with their own room on the 14th. The entrance to the Lobby was fantastic - but I understand that they will be remodeling the check-in area real soon. Location wise real close to the GLD, PETCO & the water. Just 3 miles to Lindberg - real convenient. Rooms were furnished very well - LCD TV's (they need to update the room pixs :-D )

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous! Will be back”
Reviews.Author: Kmredd
Reviews.Content: Bed is so comfortable! Location makes it worth the money. Service is great, everyone is very friendly. Would not advise eating in their restaurant, too many good ones close by to waste $ on ok food. Be advised that parking is $32 per day. I will be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Go Green? Not!”
Reviews.Author: Paul F
Reviews.Content: I give the front end staff good marks for customer care. This venue rates a 2 star due to the rooms and the ability to provide requested items. We had a double and when we requested extra towels they were dumped on the sink. The maid service if it existed was not poor it was terrible. When walking to the room and the maid would be at a room they would quickly duck in the room to avoid any contact for fear you may ask for something. For the cost of the room one should not pay an additional fee for Wi-Fi. The room was never serviced for trash or just a touch up. Very Very sad for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value.”
Reviews.Author: Derfel
Reviews.Content: I got a good deal here by pre-paying on their website, but couldn't help wondering if everything would be OK -- as the deal wasn't refundable. But -- I needn't have worried. Everything was fine. We asked for a quiet room. We got one on the 11th floor which was quite quiet, after 10 PM. (It was on the side of the building with the outdoor pool, which is open till 10.) The walls were thick enough so we didn't hear our neighbors. The room had been recently renovated, so everything was new, including the mattresses. (The renovation killed one of the phone lines, according to hotel maintenance, but the other phone in the room worked.) There are 4 elevators so there was never much of a wait. Our room was in an L-shape, with a desk in the L-part. A mini-fridge was large enough to stock some groceries we bought at the 24/7 Ralphs supermarket around the corner. The location is great for tourists. It's right by the Gaslamp district, which is home to San Diego's major restaurant/nightlife district. San Diego has an excellent public transportation system and the Westin Gaslamp is right on several major lines, making Balboa Park/Zoo, Hillcrest, and Little Italy easily to get to. (Don't confuse the Westin Gaslamp with the Westin Hotel on Broadway, a few blocks away.) The waterfront is within walking distrance -- about 6 short blocks. We didn't have a car -- parking in this area is very expensive -- but we found we didn't need it to get around, though admittedly getting out to La Jolla might have been a bear if we hadn't taken a tour. Quick shopping is easy: there's a CVS on the block and a mall behind the hotel, besides Ralphs around the block. Internet access was $9.95/night. We screwed up the access by connecting our Kindles to the system while our laptop was also connected. (Apparently if you have more than 1 device, you should notify them first.) After the issue was resolved, they comp'd the Internet charge for the entire time. That was a really nice thing to do on their part. The staff was very friendly -- housekeeping, front desk, concierge, bellhops.... Downsides: the bedsheets were not soft, there's no soda machine in the building, and there's no microwave. But these are really minor compared to the pluses. I'd stay here again on another trip to SD.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: GoAZCats23
Reviews.Content: Returned last week from a 5 night stay at the Westin Gaslamp. Was in town with the family for a baseball tournament. The room was clean and the beds super comfy. Started every morning with a visit by our family to the Cafe Express/Starbucks. Was treated superbly there every morning by the barista Selena T. We had breakfast vouchers for the tournament yet Selena went over and above by making nice hot chocolates and great drinks for the kids every morning with a great attitude! The front desk was also very helpful and provided very good service. The valet/bellmen were extremely busy with a great number of vehicles but did a great job of hustling and keeping organized despite the large amount of traffic due to the tournament. Will definitely stay here again as there is so much to do within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “This place needs work”
Reviews.Author: dpatters
Reviews.Content: This is a very disappointing property for Westin. One's first impression is a poor one. When you enter the hotel, the concierge desk is to your right. But where is the Check-In? It's past the concierge around the corner. Is this indicated by a sign? Of course not. In fact, when it comes to signage, this is the worst hotel I have ever visited. On the 12th floor, where we stayed, there are no signs for the elevators and only partial signage to the rooms. I had 3 people on my floor ask me "Do you know where I find the elevator?" The overall appearance of the hotel is that it is not kept clean. The carpets need to be vacuumed more often. There is an effort to keep the hotel "green" by giving you Starwood points in exchange for no daily maid service. This worked for us but the entire place looked like regular cleaning had been cut back. The pool was not very clean: I kept encountering human hair during my 7am swim. Does the filter not work? The staff is quite attentive when you ask. "Carina" at the desk answered all my questions about my reservation but the concierge was clueless. She also said she was "out of maps." Duh. Finally, they charge 10 dollars a day for wireless in your room. This is neanderthal. WIFI is free throughout an increasing number of hotels. Westin needs to get with the program. This nickel-and-diming needs to stop.

Reviews.Title: “Not the luxury I was expecting”
Reviews.Author: Lauren M
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Westin in San Fran, I expected the same level of quality, but was sorely disappointed. The carpet was worn throughout the hotel, the bathroom had no fan to siphon off the shower steam, the bathroom door was broken and did not close all the way and the 'windows you can open' didn't open. I expected an ipod dock radio clock, and when there wasn't one, I called and was told they didn't have any. On the second day, the pool closed for an unknown period of time. It was closed for two of the four days we were there. The fitness center was being remodeled. On the other hand, the concierge and valets were great! If I were to recommend this hotel, I would tell people that it was a reasonable price for the location and the hotel, but to not expect a 4 star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BestViews
Reviews.Content: Room was modern and comfortable. The hotel is very busy and the elevators are slow so have a bit of patience. There are also many, many children at the hotel so if you don't like kids and prefer a quieter place to stay, you'd best pick a higher priced hotel. The staff are very pleasant and helpful. The first weekend was very noisy with teenagers running around the floor and having noisy parties. After the weekend though, the hotel became much more calm and relaxing. The Horton Plaza with tons of shopping is just a 30 second walk from the hotel. There's also a great Thai restaurant (ignore the decor) called Thai Time just in front of the hotel. For cheap breakfasts and lunches, Panera Bread is across the street. The Gaslamp restaurant area is about a ten minute walk away. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego is beautiful even for one night”
Reviews.Author: KaptainKool
Reviews.Content: I spend alot of time in SD for business and pleasure. This time was business in downtown. You have to be careful and not go to the wrong Westin. It's about four blocks away. I thought my cab driver new his way. The hotel is in a great location next to the Westfield Horton Plaza Mall and right in the middle of the Gaslamp district. The hotel had a very good breakfast buffet and plenty of complimentary citrus flavored water.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Restaurant!!”
Reviews.Author: tinalee_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed the weekend at the hotel for a mini vacation in the middle of July. We spent most of the time at the hotel and in the surrounding downtown area. It was a lovely stay and we had a lot of fun as well. One of the highlights of the trip was the pleasure we had of meeting Michel the bartender and waitress in the restaurant and lobby. The first night we were there, Michele made a huge impact on the kids and they became friends right way. The kids made it a point to go visit "Shell" any time we passed through the restaurant area. It was pretty adorable. Michel provided great service and offered wonderful suggestions for things to do in the area as well. we felt like we had our own trip planner :). I was thoroughly impressed. She should be an even coordinator someday. Thanks Westin and thank you Michele!

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous birthday weekend in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: SlickTravels
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a wonderful weekend in San Diego celebrating my birthday. The Westin Gaslamp was comfortable and conveniently located for just about everything we wanted to do. The room could have been cleaned better and we often had to ask for extra toiletries, but the concierge service was terrific. They even sent me a bottle of champagne the night of my birthday. I'd definitely go back

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, but still inconvenient”
Reviews.Author: Mohtraveling
Reviews.Content: I try to give all hotels a chance, but this one I just couldn't. Yes, the location is excellent. You are walking distance to everything in the Gaslamp Quarter including the mall. The room is your typical hotel room, but we found that it wasn't cleaned thoroughly when we arrived. There were tons of hair on the bathroom floor from the previous guests. I'm pretty sure the cleaning staff just did a quick pick-up instead of actually cleaning it. Here's where the hotel is inconvenient: No shuttle (from and to the hotel from the airport, you're on your own) No free wifi ($9.99/day, but they have complimentary wifi in the lobby that's slower than 3G) No business center (There's a computer cafe that charges to use it, what a rip-off) No digital channels (Not too important, but we found nothing to watch on TV after hours when we weren't tired to go to sleep) No vending machines (If you want a soda, pay $5, if you want snacks, pay $5) No free parking (You MUST use the $32/night valet if you plan on using a car) On top of all that, the elevators are almost always crowded so you're having to wait for the next one. For a hotel to brag about how they're always booked, they need to get more elevators going! The front desk staff aren't very knowledgeable if you're asking about where and how to get somewhere. The valet or bellhop was more helpful. And lastly, because they were booked solid, the hotel was loud with tons of kids running around like they haven't been out of the house in weeks. The staff basically said "You're just going to have to deal with it even after hours." Here's some tips if you do decide to stay here: The Broadway Pier (that hosts the harbor cruise tours and Coronado Ferry) is definitely walking distance regardless of what front desk says. It's about 10-15 minute walk and it'll save you cab fare. PETCO Park is also walking distance, but Balboa Park is not. Little Italy is walking distance, but the airport is not.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: CT_Programmer
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight in adjoining rooms with the kids on the 9th floor. We definitely enjoyed the stay, even though it was short. The staff was outstanding and very helpful and courteous. The rooms are decorated very nicely, with sitting chairs that are very comfortable. The beds are the best I've slept in at a hotel, with the exception of the Ritz-Carlton in NYC. Very nice beds. Lots of pillows. The bathrooms are nice, but a typical hotel bathroom with a shower curtain. Not very upscale. The pool is on the 3rd floor open to the outside with a nice view and was a good temperature, but had to get Visine later due to the chlorine. We had a room on the east side, so the view was ok. Could see the circle outside the lobby (with a 7 story obelisk) and towards the mall. The lobby has a small cafe, but there's also a Panera right across the street and Starbucks near the mall, as well as tons of places within a block or two. All in all had a very good stay and would definitely recommend to anyone staying in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Arizona6600
Reviews.Content: Our team stayed at this hotel for a local baseball tournament. The hotel was packed and parking was extremely tight, very difficult to find a place to park in the small round-about. The valet took upwards of 20 minutes to get our vehicle, at times (the standard appears to be about 10 minutes). Also, my new car was dented (I am still waiting for a call back from the hotel regarding their investigation). The room was clean and neat, the front desk friendly, but they seem under staffed for other areas. The water was shut down in the middle of the day (11am to 1pm) which is very inconvenient for travelers (why not pick the middle of the night where less guests would be impacted??). Also, for rooms ordering room service, it appears dishes/settings were not picked up for days, we left items out for pick up and they were in the hall for 3 days (as were items from other rooms - I would assume a pick up each day, rather than having dirty glasses and plates in the hall). This Westin does not appear to be on par with other Westin hotels. And lastly, the fitness center was closed for the last part of our trip (the hotel will provide passes to a nearby center, but still inconvenient).

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: stavros_philpot
Reviews.Content: We had a superb time in San Diego, due in no small part to the location and quality of the hotel. The Gaslamp quarter is definitely the place to stay; loads of restaurants, lots of bars and good shopping, very clean and a fun place to stay. The hotel was very clean, large rooms, swimming pool and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Close to Everything.”
Reviews.Author: welzeinz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is directly adjacent to the Horton Plaza Mall, so there is plenty of shopping nearby. There are also lots of restaurants nearby so you won't run out of food options. The hotel was very full and always bustling with lots of people. The pool area is nice, but small. Overall, this is a great hotel and we will definitely consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Gaslamp...we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: kjoconnor
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Westin Galamp - San Diego and we had a great experience. The room was comfortable, the bed really awesome, the bathroom counter was a bit small, the room was quiet and the best thing is that the hotel is centrally located so we were able to get to the Zoo quickly, Shelter Island and Coronado with relative ease. We didn't have a car as we took the train from LA to San Diego, but that didn't impact us too badly as we used the bus and taxis to get around. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Selena in the Coffee Shop”
Reviews.Author: rgncarpenter
Reviews.Content: It's rare that you find someone who is willing to help as I found while on my stay at the Westin Gaslamp in downtown San Diego while there with friends for Comic Con. Selena in the coffee shop was so very nice and accodated all of our questions with a smile. Thanks so much Selena--we will book our rooms at the westin again next year for Comic Con!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BB_Mke
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel is very nice. I thought the rooms were really nice, if a little generic and uninteresting. Very comfortable beds and nice sized bedroom and bathroom. Great view. Reasonably close the convention center. (10 - 15 min walk) with plenty of buses and trolleys within blocks. Very close to loads of dining and entertainment. I got this room on a cash and points deal through my credit card, so it was an exceptional deal for me. We stayed at the Westin San Diego on our first night and this hotel on the last night. I found the Westin San Diego (on Broadway) a nicer hotel overall. I was disappointed to discover that Westin Gaslamp didn't have an airport shuttle when Westin San Diego (just a few blocks away) did. But it's quite cheap to grab a cab to the airport from downtown (about $15), so this wasn't a terrible inconvenience. I was just disappointed that I didn't reserve my hotels the other way around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Lauren00616
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a weekend getaway. It's a nice hotel in a great location, walking distance to the Horton Plaza, downtown shopping and lots of restaurants. Be aware that Valet is the exclusive hotel parking option here and it's fairly pricey (not surprising for a downtown property). The front desk clerk was kind enough to inform us of a self parking garage just round the corner of the hotel which was a very short walk and appreciably less expensive in comparison. We found the hotel staff friendly and professional, housekeeping did a good job and although the workout facility was rather small, it was sufficiently equipped to get a good workout done. There is an indoor jacuzzi and outdoor pool, both smaller in comparison to other Westin properties that we've stayed at. Overall, the Westin Gaslamp Quarter was a pleasant stay in a great location!

Reviews.Title: “Clean room - Great location - nothing for children...”
Reviews.Author: Lisajb1
Reviews.Content: Just returned today from in my opinion "one of the worst Westin properties" that I have stayed at yet... My two boys ages 8 & 9 left for a 4 day trip - and I was disappointed to find that our Deluxe room was tiny... We literally could not move around... Upgraded for the Suite - was happy with the size of this room however they offer zero space to un-pack your clothes/essentials... This is the first hotel I have stayed that did not offer a DVD player... The pool is very boring... They don't even have any channels that are kid friendly... This is stritcly a business hotel in my opinion... It was clean the Concierge was friendly and helpful... But - for my family - we will not return... Great place if you are single and looking to be close to nightlife and restaurants - great shopping location...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice - great location”
Reviews.Author: alsebete
Reviews.Content: Arrived in San Diego as Comic-Con opened (I just happened to be passing through not for Comic-Con). Westin-Gaslamp is great location for things within walking distance. Hotel staff members were friendly and helpful and the room was clean. Only stayed one night but would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great But Not Terrible Either”
Reviews.Author: nerdtude
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 8 days with my family.The beds where comfortable with an updated room with some quirks. The LG flat screen TV is analog only (NO High Definion TV here) but the maintenance staff went out of their way to compensate us for the really bad reception. The lighting was so bad I couldn't see to put water in the coffee maker without opening all the windows up. The bay view I received as a free upgade was great. The bathroom smelled like the sewer with no exhast fan inside it but the rooms have operating windows which work to vent the fumes. I was aware of the extra charges for both internet access and parking so we did not rent a car and even though we did not use the valets they where very nice offering us water and hailed cabs for us. We used free access points which are plentiful and all around the gaspoint district for free internet. The Concierge's were very helpful ,knowledgable about the area. This Westin is changing hands and I'm not sure if it will still be part of the starwood group but it does not offer the concierge lounge services.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: Spitza
Reviews.Content: Every employee we encountered was gracious and helpful. The room was clean, the beds were comfortable, and the size of the room was just fine for me, my husband and our 3-yr-old (who set up his Thomas train tracks on the floor every night). We especially enjoyed receiving a room on the 4th floor with sliding glass doors that led out to an open-air terrace. My husband and I could leave our sleeping son in the room with the sliding doors open, and sit right outside the room enjoying the great weather. Also, my son loved running around the terrace. The location was fabulous. It was so easy to walk to the harbor or down to Fifth Avenue where all the "action" was happening. We will stay here again and ask for a fourth floor room leading out to the terrace. (Paying for slow internet and the expensive parking was a drag, but all in all, it was a great stay.)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect 10”
Reviews.Author: IAMWHIN1
Reviews.Content: Top notch hotel that provides impeccable level of service that makes you feel appreciated! Perfect downtown location with plenty of shopping and restaurants right outside your door. Trolley a short walk and taxi's are abundant. Rooms are very clean and beds are a dream. As someone who travels weekly, I wish I could have this experience everytime! Thank you Westin!

Reviews.Title: “Westin Gas Lamp Quarter”
Reviews.Author: dglvtotrvl
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the Westin, at this location. It's a perfect location to be in San Diego. We are always treated very well, and staff is always friendly and helpful. The hotel is clean and and well maintained. We also like the "Green Choice", which means that the room is not cleaned every day. You also have the choice to have the maid service daily, but we perferred not to have housekeeping in every day. We just asked for extra coffee or towels when needed. You can save money by doing this too. The only drawback is the $32.00 charge for parking daily. And it's valet parking only, so you have the added charge for that too. So for 5 days we paid over $160.00 for parking-not including the valet's tips. For this reason, I rated the hotel very good, rather than excellent. I wish therre was some way to use Starwood hotel points for the parking charges. I would highly recommend staying at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Mitch Edmonson Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: StoneAlone
Reviews.Content: I am 6'7" but my travel agent out me in a twin bed room...I called the property on the way down and asked for some help, and at the time they were overbooked with Comic Con. Mitch said that he would do his best to help...and he ACTUALLY did. Nobody was displaced...just a few changes. So after a 15 hour day, I not only got the larger bed but it was even in a better room (I am a Starwood member). The property...from the desk staff to the housekeeping staff to the fabulous valet parking team NAILS it...I am Hilton Gold but will stay here always. Thanks Mitch and gang!

Reviews.Title: “Great accomadations, impeccable service!!”
Reviews.Author: Dee1982_11
Reviews.Content: You couldn't ask for better service. Monica in marketing and the front desk were extremely helpful. Hotels can have super employees, but when you receive this type of star-service, you are more than impressed!! I will definitely be back and recommend to all!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: TAbernethy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Gaslamp after attending a conference. This hotel is ideally located to visiting the sites in San Diego. Walking distance to Petco Park, the convention center and Gaslamp quarter and a quick ride to Coronado. The hotel is clean and modern with a great pool on the third floor and a nice lobby bar. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: gramtaft
Reviews.Content: We stayed on Sunday night, got a great rate. The room was excellant, not much of a view but it was OK, the amenities in the room were great, very clean and well appointed, bed was very comfortable(king), good pillows, all staff contact was very gracious and accommodating, it was in walking distance to everywhere we wanted to go. The only downside was the overnight parking rate was very stiff at $36. No other choices around. We would certainly stay there again and encourage others to do so.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel will nickel and dime you to death.”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel92606
Reviews.Content: While I was able to get a decent rate for this hotel through Hotwire, the first thing I noticed was gum jammed into the carpet between the two beds. Also, the hotel staff did not replace the shampoo and conditioner and we had to call down to get more in order to bathe our children. Overall, these may be little issues, but when a hotel does this while also charging $32 for valet-only parking a night and also charges $10 a night for internet access which is purposely slow so you will buy the $15 a night access, it borders on robbery.

Reviews.Title: “Selena at the Westin in San Diego at the cafe house.”
Reviews.Author: ruti2
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, the service at the coffee shop was lovely. rooms are nice and well equipped great location exercise equipment outdated

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Crazycruiser59
Reviews.Content: My son had his wedding reception here. Though there was a slight problem with the reservations, all was resolved quickly. Everyone that worked here greeted us with a smile and very helpful. Even the parking valet person ran into the hotel to get us a map to the church. There was a water pipe that broke under the hotel. With getting ready for the wedding, no water and numerous guests, the hotel handled everything professionally. The wedding reception was outstanding. We were right next door to a shopping mall and restaurants were within walking distance. I would definitely come back. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: noworries214
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly. We loved the room and it had a great view of the city. The bed was incredibly comfortable. It was located in the heart of downtown so their were numerous places to eat. We loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service compliments to front desk agent Raquel Robinson...”
Reviews.Author: lotuslette
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful and very clean. The morning staff was inviting!

Reviews.Title: “Very family friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lesvegas50
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our infant and four year old daughter this past weekend. The staff was so friendly and helpful. They put many other families on the same floor so it was fun and we didn't worry about noise. The beds were comfortable and value was great. The price for valet was expensive and they charge for Internet but the price was so reasonable it wasn't too bad. Great location with lots to do and eat for kids. Would highly recommend for families.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay. We've been back a few times.”
Reviews.Author: Wangbar
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times for business and for pleasure. I will definately stay again when Im next in San Diego. The rooms are nice and clean, the beds very comfortable and your right in the heart of the city. Best of all the staff are friendly and only too happy to help.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Yorkietourists
Reviews.Content: We had a nicely furnished hotel room (a bay room view) on the 15th floor with somewhat distant bay views! Hotel was very well kept and really clean and in a great location just a 5min walk from the main drag in the gaslamp quarter and literally 30secs from the shops in the Horton Plaza. Only downside is you can here the trains sounding their horns on a night, but I think all downtown hotels probably have a similar issue, and to be honest we only heard it around 10.30pm on 2 nights. Staff all friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Polarsun1
Reviews.Content: The staff at the front desk are extremely helpful and friendly. I stay at a lot of hotels as an airline pilot (at a bunch of different Westin's too) - and THIS hotel goes the extra mile to ensure your every need is taken care of to your complete satisfaction. I am in the process of buying a house while on the road - and a lot of paperwork and messages were flying back and forth. I could count on the Westin / Gas Lamp staff in San Diego to take the extra effort and diligence to ensure my business needs were all taken care of. As a result - I got the home! Thanks to Matt, and all the other fabulously enthusiastic Westin Hotel staff at the Gas Lamp! Great rooms and Nice pool / gym too! Excellent location!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very comfortable rooms, nice amenities, great service”
Reviews.Author: ralph078
Reviews.Content: From the time that we checked in at valet parking until we left, the experience was top notch. They were very customer-focused. For the location and the price, I think we should expect that, but it was still nice to have it that way. The main reason I'm writing this is because when I called back to say a special thanks to Luis in housekeeping for following thru on my request to look for a couple shirts that I had left, the person who answered was grateful to hear the good feedback and asked me to post it to tripadvisor.com, so that Luis' name might get entered into a Westin employee contest to win a trip to Hawaii. So, I'm taking a guess this is the place to record that. I think most of you know that if you leave something behind in your hotel room, you might as well kiss it goodbye. But Luis took the extra step and actually found that I had left 5 shirts behind (sheesh!) and then took my info to mail them to me. I got them back and for that, I am very appreciative of Luis' great service.

Reviews.Title: “Vintage Westin in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Danny38
Reviews.Content: I chaperoned four high school students from Upstate New York for four nights at the National Junior Science and Humanities Symposium (JSHS) at the Westin Gaslamp Quarter hotel in San Diego at the end of April, 2011. The hotel is in an attractive area of San Diego. My room was very attractive and the hotel was also attractive – what I expect from Westin Hotels. I particularly liked the outdoor rooftop facility, which is accessed from the fourth floor. This was an attractive area to eat and talk with other Symposium participants. The food was excellent. All meals except the final banquet were cafeteria style, which made for rapid serving of the 500 or so in attendance. I didn’t use a hotel restaurant. I noted that a Panera Bakery and Café, which is ideal for someone who wants lighter fare at a reasonable price, was just across the street from the entrance to the hotel. We chaperones were told not to allow our charges to go to Mexico because it is dangerous. “If you get in trouble in Mexico, no JSHS staff member will go to your assistance, nor will a US Border Control agent.” I did permit my delegation to use public transportation to go to the San Diego Zoo as a group without me. The Zoo is truly one of the “must see” attractions in the United States. I let them do this because they are responsible, highly-motivated young people (“we are not the kind of students who get into trouble”, as I was once told by such a student), and because the public transport option is convenient and safe from the hotel to the Zoo.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel staff in san diego”
Reviews.Author: mr_lopez
Reviews.Content: I love it here at the westin gaslamp in san diego. I am on business here for the next 6 months and I consider this my home. it is awsome, the staff at the front desk as well as all others are amazing and always very helpful. Raquel Robinson is super and is a definate asset to this orgination. The entire staff is great all the ladies and gentlemen at the front desk both day and night crew are always going the extra mile for all guest no matter what. The bell staff and parking attendants, the bar, restaurant. housekeeping as well as management are all amazing professionals and never expect anything back. I will continue to be a guest here as long as i am in San diego. Thank you Westin gaslamp.... Christian Lopez

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed this hotel”
Reviews.Author: SDtraveler99
Reviews.Content: I am actually from SD but stayed down here for a convntion last week. I've got to say the best thing about this place is the location, everything else is pretty average. The bar is great though and had great service from Michele a couple of the nights. She was the most friendly person I encountered during my stay. I'll definitely frequent the restaurant/bar when i am downtown in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: LaTechEE
Reviews.Content: The stay at the hotel was wonderful. The hotel staff was super friendly and made me feel at home. The location is excellent! Newly renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ksall31
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in an absolutely great location, the rooms were clean and updated. The staff was very helpful and friendly. I was visiting my son who is stationed at Camp Pendleton and would definitely stay here again . My only complaint is that parking was expensive but from what I understand that is common in the hotels in the San Diego area. At least I could come and go without having to pay for each time I parked in a 24 hour period, the charge was per 24 hour period.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Dec98us
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent and all staff members were friendly. Rooms were recently renovated with comfortable heavenly beds. It is centrally located next to Horton Plaza and surprisingly quiet. Only downside is parking cost $32.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Frida03
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, close to the airport, the port and most tourist attractions, including the Convention Center!!! If you want to enjoy the city walking around, I recommend this hotel, because it's on the center of everything!!! If you like to do shopping, you have a shopping center next to the hotel, with stores like Macy's, Nordstrom, Coach and a lot more.....

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful people”
Reviews.Author: Kpatton19
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right next to Horton Plaza and within walking distance to the waterfront. We used taxi's and walked. It was less expensive and much nicer than having a car. The concierge, Catherine Bouver was amazing. She got us into some fun restaurants and arranged transportation for us to a concert. Everyone working at the hotel that we encountered were friendly and helpful. San Diego is a great city full of friendly people!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice hotel and Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: AlexandriaGrandDad
Reviews.Content: stayed in one of their newly rennovated rooms. Very nice. Hotel personnel very helpful in giving sightseeing tips and haw to get around on public transport

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service. Very classy staff.”
Reviews.Author: cosmo105
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights during the Rock and Roll Marathon weekend. Requested an upper level corner room with an early check in and recieved all three. Concierge staff took care of all three nights dinner reservations and did an excellent job choosing the right places. Very friendly and knowledgeable staff. Location of the hotel is perfectly situated within walking distance to the Gaslamp area, downtown (Broadway st.), and the port where you can catch the ferry to Coronado Island. Excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a weekend getaway in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: RickNStl
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for the great rate and the brand reputation. It has an excellent location with a shopping mall attached and a vast array of food nearby. Nice room but the hotel itself seemed small compared to the typical Westin. The staff were top-notch as the front desk, concierge and maid service all went out of their way to see that we had everything we needed for a pleasant weekend in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it and will be back”
Reviews.Author: jeannie76_1
Reviews.Content: It is the perfect spot for business and pleasure. Great access to everything from business districts, eating and to sightseeing and don't forget the shopping center if you forgot or need anything. Room was excellent and so was the service.

Reviews.Title: “Same place next year for the marathon”
Reviews.Author: centerc
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived to the moment we left our experience was fantastic. There was always a friendly smile on every employees face. I especially enjoyed Selena in the cafe express.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING!!!”
Reviews.Author: OliviaVvv
Reviews.Content: A couple of friends and I stayed here through the weekend of the Rock N Roll Marathon. The hotel and hotel staff are all wonderful, very accomodating. Love the $5 incentive program for opting out of room cleaning services. What made our stay even more enjoyable was the Lovely Selena T., the hotel barista, she met us every morning with a smile and superb customer service! Thanks a Million!!! O. Velez

Reviews.Title: “Restin at the Westin for the RNR marathon”
Reviews.Author: TNTCoach
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to San Diego for the marathon and my second stay at this Westin location. I am a big Westin fan, love the bedding and the amenities.The location was great, close enough to walk to almost everything, however the hotel booked a promo the night before the race. Unfortunately it soundsed like it was in the room with us. The front desk assuring me it would be over promptly at 11PM and sent up some foam earplugs that did not provide us with the peace and quite and much needed pre-race rest. I was not the only runner staying there. It was a huge mistake on the Westin's part not to consider that. I'm not sure if I will stay here next year, before I make my decision I will check to see if there are any proms booked.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has incredible service and wonderful employees”
Reviews.Author: victoriaf72
Reviews.Content: I had a conference at the Westin June 3rd through June 5th. Never have I experienced such incredible generousity and great customer service at a hotel...actually, one person in particular comes to mind -- Catharine Bouvier, who works in the front hotel lobby. This sweet soul went above and beyond in helping me this weekend. I did not want to keep paying money to buy water bottles, so every time I ran out of water, she dropped what she was doing, and went completely out of her way to fill up my water bottle from non tap water. She did this 4 times throughout the weekend. I could not believe it! Such incredible generousity and kindness for no reason whatsoever. Also, I had forgotten some toiletry items and the nice people at the front desk did not hesitate to get me everything that I needed. I loved this hotel. It is right next to the Horton Plaza Mall and incredibly convenient as well. I very much recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: tripcasey
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a big group, we all came for the San Diego Marathon. We really enjoyed this hotel, it is close to so many things. We didn't have rental cars, so we were able to walk everywhere in the Gaslamp area. There's a CVS Pharmacy and a couple of retail clothing stores right next door (a mall) and behind the hotel is a Ralph's grocery. There are many restaurants nearby such as Panera Bread and Baja Fresh -- I know those are fast food places but they were done tastefully and upscale like the whole area. The popular upscale restaurants are within walking distance and we also walked to Petco Park (~ 3/4 of a mile). There's a train station next door as well. Now on to the hotel -- Beds/Linens - very comfortable Air Conditioner wouldn't cool down as low as we had the thermostat. I normally keep mine on 74 but we had it down on 62 and it did not feel cool enough. Bathrooms were pretty spacious for a hotel in its class, and came with a plush bathrobe and plenty of nice plush towels. Toiletries were of high quality. The pool area is nothing to write home about (it is heated but small). They do have towel service at the pool. Workout area is very nice for a hotel in its class, has everything you'd need for a decent workout. The rooms were in very good condition although I thought the decorating was on the cheap - there were only two pieces of (ugly) artwork and one had a wonky frame. The carpet was in great condition. Toiletries smelled good, no need to bring your own soap and shampoo. Hotel lobby is very nice and has a beautiful staircase, there is also free WI-FI in the lobby. If you want WI-FI in your room its $10 a day, or $27 for 3 days, I thought was kind of high. I've recently started staying at Westin hotels (usually I do Hiltons) and I can say that I don't really have any complaints, we had a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Cobb Salad Ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: OrangeGG
Reviews.Content: I am a huge fan of Cobb Salad so when I see one on a menu I always order it. I feel if the restaurant makes good Cobb Salad everything else will be great too! Truly was not disappointed at The Westin Gaslamp...the Cobb Salad was the best ever. The presentation was excellent and ingredients were so fresh, no dressing was needed, to me the qualities of absolute goodness! As those with me, their food looked fabulous as well...DEFINITELY a return visit to The Westin Gaslamp!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome corporate retreat!”
Reviews.Author: mulligna
