Reviews.Content: We had a great day at the Westin Gaslamp at our corporate retreat last week. The room was very nice, with a patio that was lovely for our meals. The food was incredible, particularly the morning and afternoon snack breaks...especially the make your own trail mix station. Our Convention Services Manager, Martha Michener, was very receptiive to our needs, and helped to ensure everything went flawless. I would highly recommend this property for business meetings and meals.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch experience”
Reviews.Author: EC202020
Reviews.Content: Our MDW stay at the Westin was great. Everyone was very friendly and accommodating (we were traveling with a baby and dog).

Reviews.Title: “WESTIN GASLAMP”
Reviews.Author: druanne
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay at the westin and loved the area and all it had to offer. everyone was great - the concierge - and im sorry i cant remember her name was very friendly and helpful. as was all the staff. there was one exception - the hot tub - which was filled with little kids even at 9pm and the foam was abt a foot tall - our thoughts are that the hot tub should be serviced at some point and then used by adults only in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “They need to really look into their customer service”
Reviews.Author: kodySydney
Reviews.Content: On first arrival I was greeted with a very friendly bell boy and then it went down hill. The Hotel itself is not bad don't expect 5 star more 2 -3 star . The best service is in the restaurant now they are 5 star. I needed to get change of $100 as I needed to leave there was a long line for check in so I went to the side to the receptionist called Gina. She was so rude and unfriendly and told me did you stand in line I said I am not checking in but need change. She became really rude and I said can I speak to the manager on duty he was even ruder than Gina. He told me "This is the way its done in the States" what happened to customer service. Next day I was checking out and ofcourse the bill was wrong they charged me for breakfast when I had the breakfast package and again I had the rude Gina. Needless to say I will never stay at this hotel and neither will any of my colleges. Terrible customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Had an amazing MDW in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: Bigboat_11
Reviews.Content: Some friends and I decided last min to come to SD for the holiday and stopped for the night at the Westin. Little did we know that it would be one of the best parts of the stay! Great atmosphere at the bar and pretty good food however a little pricey but hey it is the westin. Had a blast next door at yard house and stopped by for a drink and stayed for several. Ask for michele, great server and cool girl. Gave us the heads up on local places that we went to the next day. Viva SD!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay...”
Reviews.Author: VDawg1621
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very accommodating to all of our needs during our short stay. Xalan was extremely helpful in helping our family find certain places around the area. Our television was not working at first and a technician was promptly sent up to assist us. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anybody. The location is close to everything and the staff was excellent. Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Overcharged for room”
Reviews.Content: Stay with the hotel on May 22, 2011 and check out on May 25, 2011. The hotel overchaged me for a room. Was on travel with an employee and I was under the impression that they charged me for both room. But after returning to work the following day, my colleagues informed me that his card was charged as well? Call hotel about overcharge and staff was rude and unhelpful. Called hotel when reservation was set up and was told everything was corrected on their end, but never received a updated confirmation. Here is the interesting part, my colleague and myselft had the same confirmation number, but different rates? Hotel never corrected the reservation on their side and I paid double for my room. We took the same trip, stayed at the same hotel, he was put under my reservation, even though he had his own room and I paid double. Hotel is would even hear reason, staff had a so what out look. Customer service is the wrost.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service!”
Reviews.Author: zakarymcqueen
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely and our stay in San Diego was amazing. We will definitely be back! The one thing that made a huge difference in our stay was the barista in the express cafe--Selena T. She was very sweet and very knowledgeable about the San Diego area. Since our trip was last minute I really appreciated her taking the time to tell me about the city and places to visit. Not only did she help me the day I asked her and make me an amazing original creation, but she had a list made out of places we might want to see and things we might want to do that she had not mentioned the day before. She was amazing! The hotel was amazing and San Diego was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Great Atmosphere! Best Bartender Award - Michele!!!”
Reviews.Author: GenieInABottle95
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin in San Diego while in town for business. Always happy to be put up in a Westin, but this one was outstanding. Great staff all around. My favorite was the bartender - Michele. Always has a smile on her face, made great suggestions, and great conversation (no complaints on the drinks either!). Can't wait until my next trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful people make this hotel the place to stay in downtown san diego”
Reviews.Author: EricH1956
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 30 days April - May 2011. The hotel is most convenient to the federal courthouse, the Westgate Mall, public transportation. All major brand hotels have nice rooms, pools, etc. What makes this hotel different are the people who work there. From the bell staff to the concierge staff (particularly Catherine) to the front desk staff, the people make this hotel special. Yes, the Gaslamp district can be noisy, but if you have to stay downtown, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: madamx613
Reviews.Content: could not been in a better location, mall almost next door restaurants all around all kinds of foods the trolley stops in about half block, the staff at the hotel very nice and helpful at all times, the only thing we did not like was the 32.00 valet parking fee, which is the only parking the hotel has. The rest just wonderful, thanks from the Miller family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, bad weekend.”
Reviews.Author: caitiesand
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay thinking we got a great deal. Turns out there was a senior prom the Saturday night of our stay. There was nothing mentioned on the website when we booked our room. This hotel would have been perfect if they had just let us know. Makes me rethink staying with this brand of hotels if they keep things like senior proms from their guests. If I had known I could have prepared myself, instead I was met in the lobby by 20 highschool seniors. I barely went to my own senior prom, why would I want to go to their senior prom?!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, great location”
Reviews.Author: kimmiplease
Reviews.Content: It is in the heart of downtown, you can definitely walk anywhere and the mall is 2 mins away. All the staff was very kind and helpful. 1 employee stuck out more then the rest, her name is Michelle Escodedo, i think she was a server or bartender. she was very polite, funny and just was very calm and relaxed. I have been to this hotel before and has had great service from here and decided i needed to write a review. There are great restaurants right around the corner, a great affordable sushi restaurant, brewery, pizza kitchen etc... It is also about 7 mins away from the water and airport. all and all this restaurant is convenient and has great staff.

Reviews.Title: “BEST hotel room I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: LindseyJ912
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about my phenomenal hotel room at Westin Gaslamp Quarter in downtown San Diego! My room was located on the 16th floor of the hotel, overlooking the city. The suite was bi- level including a dining room, kitchen, living room and bedroom and amazing bathroom upstairs. The staff was extremely friendly and all customer service was great! We enjoyed massages in their spa located on the 3rd floor and it was fantastic! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Would recomment -- clean, quiet and convenient”
Reviews.Author: adeason
Reviews.Content: Staff were friendly and accommodating. The room was clean and nicely decorated. Was very convenient to shopping and lots of good restaurants. Nice workout room with nice equipment. If you're staying there and want to use the exercise equipment, remember to take ear phones for the TV.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch hotel!”
Reviews.Author: s01s
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Gaslamp in May of 2011. We thoroughly enjoyed every aspect of our stay, from the delicious breakfast, to the comfortable rooms, to the friendly, excellent service and staff! Located in a prime location next to just about everything you’ll want to see and do, all within walking distance! I will definitely stay here again and highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Best staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: terrimolson
Reviews.Content: I stay here weekly and find the experience great every time! The staff is wonderful, and Gioia, Michelle, franco, Tina etc. are always willing to do whatever it takes to make my stay enjoyable. No complaints and would recommend this to all I know. Hats off to the staff for making this a great place to stay while working out of town.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Beds....nothing better!”
Reviews.Author: Annie55906
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Westin Gaslamp ... we enjoyed the new rooms; the heavenly bed was 'heavenly'; and my husband enjoyed the 'breakfast buffet' with made to order omlets... the BEST ever. The waiter who waited on us all week was so pleasant and helpful - a real enjoyable start to the day. We enjoyed being able to walk to the shops at Horton Plaza...and to all of the restaurants and stores so close to the Gaslamp Quarter. It was just truly an enjoyable stay - with wonderful people at the hotel willing to help whenever we had questions or needed advice. GOOD PLACE TO STAY!

Reviews.Title: “Westin at it's finest”
Reviews.Author: hmnyberg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Gaslamp this spring and found it very pleasant. The staff was courteous and helpful. The breakfast and a full service lunch banquet we had was delicious! The Gaslamp Quarter is a great area to hang out and find some interesting history in. The beach isn't too far either. Overall I'd stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but could use some improvements.”
Reviews.Author: robmumford
Reviews.Content: I stayed at your facility from Wednesday through Friday and had a mostly okay experience. Each morning when I showered at about 7am, the water was barely luke warm - tolerable but not the best experience. When I attempted to access the internet either through WiFi or high speed connections in my room, I had no luck at all. When I brought this to the attention of the front desk, they said that I could access the internet in the lobby for free on the hotel's WiFi but made no offer to assist with connection from my room. I also understood that there was a fee for accessing the internet from a room. As a business traveler, I find this out of the norm in most places I visit. I enjoyed my stay for the most part. The location is exactly what I needed, the hot tub availability was very helpful though I'm not sure why there are limited hours on the pool and the room itself was very comfortable. The breakfast buffet in the restaurant was fresh, quite varied and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great getaway with girlfriends!!”
Reviews.Author: chantz1
Reviews.Content: Had a great getaway with old friends!! Highly recommend the Westin Gaslamp!! Close to all great restaurants and bars, all within walking distance! Loved our bi-level suite, made us all feel like rockstars!!! CANT BEAT THE LOCATION!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was very relaxing, enjoyable and the staff was extremely helpful and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne_Henandez
Reviews.Content: We upgraded our room to have a bit more space and were pleased with the room size. The room was clean, plenty of extra towels a nice robe and fragrant toiletries. We were in San Diego for a wedding and having a Nordstrom's within walking distance was the icing on the cake. Will definitely book our future reservation using Auto Club and stay at the Westin next time we are in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, restaurant, room and especially service”
Reviews.Author: Christinemezder
Reviews.Content: I came into town for a conference and we all got rooms at the Westin. The rooms were clean, comfortable and in a great location to SD downton gaslamp district. The reason I decided to write this review was due to the excellent amazing service at the Hotel Restaurant whcih we ate at quite a few times during our stay. The food was great but the service was truly amazing, the server who waited on us the most was Michele E. Each time we came in she had a big smile to greet us, sat u right away, got our food and drinks fast and we never had to wait. But most importantly it was the conversation. She told us good places to visit, stay and had so much information for us. She is the main reason we will go back there next time we visit even when it is for personal travel and not business.

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent Service but room and hotel facility nice”
Reviews.Author: BotRoad
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff (Matt particularly), valet (Chris) and bell service is excellent but service is inconsistent team member to team member and among other areas of the hotel like the restaurant. I stayed 2x back to back weeks in April - first visit, Matt at the front desk set the pace with a great check-in (friendly, professional and follow-through on items I requested for my room), The restaurant service was not so up to par w/attitude and professionalism and they messed up my check which I did not learn of until I checked out. When I shared my issues w/the front desk they immediately asked what they could do to resolve/make my stay more complete and did it. The second week/visit, not so great - Matt was again helpful eventhough he was not checking us in - he rememebered us and made sure we rec'd our items in the room again. This time the issue was the wake-up call came an hour early and when I told them this and asked them to call back at thr right time, the call never came and I missed my meeting start. Second, the restaurant again messed up my check which I learned about at check-out again. Third, when I checked out around 12:15 (which check-out time for all hotels, there was only 1 person at the front desk with a lot of people waiting around to be helped. Lastly, when I checked out and was asked again how my stay was and I relayed the above- the gentleman just kept asking me if I knew who the person (name, man or woman, etc) was that messed up my wake up call (it was 545a I didn't ask for a name) - not the point! And he did nothing to mitigate the inconsistent service. Hotel's facility, room and location are superior. I stay here b/c it is located exactly where my meetings occur so while I'd stay again, I hope the GM of this hotel works on some of this b/c I may be forgiving but the next one not so much,

Reviews.Title: “Tim --, director of front office - rude and disrepectful but portrays himself otherwisef”
Reviews.Author: TimDman
Reviews.Content: Parking fee of $30/night is not reflected on checkout in their website but does come out after payment is processed. Tim --, who is the director of front office told me to educate myself next time. Is this the type of behavior you expect from someone in customer service - highly unlikely.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: SaraPA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Gaslamp for 4 nights through Priceline and enjoyed our stay. It is conveniently located (5-10 car ride) to the Gaslamp district, the zoo, downtown, Petco Park and airport. We stayed in a newly renovated room, which was neat, clean and nicely furnished. I appreciated the nice showerhead and variety of pillows (some soft, some firm etc). Found the rooms quiet for the most part. Never heard normal conversation or toilet flushing, but had one night when I was awoken by drunks coming back to the room. Not the hotels fault—they were just rude and loud. Everyone was pleasant, staff helpful. You will be charged to death—internet was $35 for 4 days, valet $32/night. Seems in line with most major city hotels, though. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I was almost denied my last day of prepaid stay.”
Reviews.Author: practicaltraveler_10
Reviews.Content: Curious. I had a prepaid booking for 4 night via Quikbooks. When i arrived, I was told I had booked only 3 nights and that the 4th night was unavailable. I was upset and had to argue with the clerk about the legitimacy of my claim. I had to gather my paperwork to show proof that I had prepaid 4 nights. They argued that they were not responsible for the error in booking as I had booked through a 3rd party! I had a printed confirmation stating that the 3rd party had verified reservation with Westin. There were no guarantees or reassurances made until the following day, when the clerk got an ok with a supervisor. This was upsetting. I like the location and the rooms, but may look for another place to stay in the future. This was my second time this year in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, excellent shopping and location”
Reviews.Author: tognir
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in this hotel for a mixture of business and leisure. My boyfriend was working for two days at a conference in the hotel which was the main reason for our visit. Our room was nice, recently renovated so everything was new and shiny. We found all the staff in the hotel to be extremely helpful and the bar staff recommended good places to eat nearby. We had the buffet breakfast one day, not cheap but very tasty. The hotel is in a good location, near a massive shopping centre (Macy's, Abercrombie, Levi's e.t.c) and close to the Gaslamp quarter with lots of bars and restaurants. Our only issue was lots of homeless people around but we saw this all over the USA. The hotel charges for internet usage, but so did the others we visited in LA and San Francisco. We visited the zoo and balbao park, a short taxi ride away, well worth seeing if you have the time. We enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel for business and leisure.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: alwaysonvacation_35
Reviews.Content: From the moment I walked in I was greeted by every staff member with a smile. I arrived hours before check-in but was allowed to pre-register and offered the opportunity to have my luggage stored until I actually checked-in. This allowed me time to relax and explore hotel and the surrounding area. I was very surprised but happy when Raquel offered to call me on my cell phone once my room was ready. When she left the voicemail it was pleasant and I appreciated her saying that I didn't have to rush back and that I could stop pass the front desk at my convenience to pick up the room key. The concierge was very knowledgeable; she took the time to help me map out my points of interests. Once I returned she asked about my sightseeing and if I was able to find everything. Later that evening I asked her where I could get a pizza for dinner and she made one phone call to a local pizza restaurant, asked for the manager and advised that guests from the Westin would be coming. She then handed me the restaurants card, which was an offer for free pizza. Even though, it was just a pizza place the service provided by the concierge made me feel like I was going to a fine dining establishment. My stay at the Westin was after a very exhausting trip overseas and it offered me the opportunity to relax. From the great service provided to me by the staff to the small gestures of kindness and the heavenly bed all were more than appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: DEG1
Reviews.Content: Although attending a conference at the convention center, a few blocks away, I'm pleasantly surprised by the amenities of the Westin. Recently renovated the owners have gathered a group of dedicated and spirited staff exemplified by one young Scott McMaster. Look for him to set the tone. Well groomed, well spoken, knowledgable and engaging he one to look for during your stay. Dining there was solid, although one is tempted to head to higher end establishments in the Gaslamp Qtr. If time doesn't permit- be confident in what you'll find on premises. Also, very close to shopping for other family members.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Paul B
Reviews.Content: The room was very comfortable and clean and the location is great

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Westin Gaslamp”
Reviews.Author: davisgr1801
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Westin Gaslamp in San Diego for a meeting. The hotel staff were helpful.... especially the concierge. I don’t usually post comments, but in this case I felt the Westin earned some recognition.

HotelInfo.Name: Westin Gaslamp Quarter, San Diego
HotelInfo.Address: 910 Broadway Circle, San Diego, CA 92101 (Formerly The Westin Horton Plaza San Diego)
